O1: The game may not begin until the coach provides a roster.
O2: The game may begin if the coach promises to provide a roster by the end of the game.
O3: The game may begin if the coach promises to provide a roster by halftime.
O4: The game may begin but the referee should remind the coach that a roster is required for future games.

Q: During the pregame warm-ups, the head referee notices Team B is wearing multiple-striped socks with no predominant color. The head referee instructs Team B to change to its single-color socks before the game begins, but will allow the team to wear the socks and report this to the state association if no other socks are available. [Rule 4-1-1c,h]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Goalkeepers are required to: [Rule 4-1-1i(1)]
openA: Have a 6-inch number on the back and a 4-inch number on the front of their jersey, pants or shorts.
O1: Have a 6-inch number on the back and front of their jersey.
O2: Have a 6-inch number on the back and a 4-inch number on the front of their jersey, pants or shorts.
O3: Have a 6-inch number on the back and no number on the front of their jersey.
O4: Have no numbers on their jersey.

Q: At the moment the ball is played by A4, teammate A2 runs from an offside position behind the defense of Team B, but at the time she receives the ball, is in an onside position. The referee should call an offside. [Rule 11-1-3; Diag. #5]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The home team's players are wearing white socks with visible black electrical tape around the top of their socks in honor of a schoolmate who has died. [Rule 4-1-1c]
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: This is permitted.
O2: This is not permitted.

Q: Team Bs head coach receives a second caution and is disqualified for receiving a second caution. The referee should display both the yellow card and the red card at the same time in the same hand. [Rule 5-3-1g]
openA: False. The referee should display the yellow card and then the red card.
O1: True
O2: False. The referee should display the yellow card and then the red card.

Q: A7 is on a breakaway, one on one with goalkeeper B1, about at the penalty spot. As A7 attempts to run around B1, B6 runs in from behind A7 and kicks him seriously off balance. As A7 falls, his right foot kicks the ball weakly toward the goal and it crosses into the goal at the far post. [Rule 12-8-1f(14)]
openA: The goal should count, B6 should be shown the red card and disqualified and the game should be restarted with a kickoff by Team B.
O1: The goal should not be counted, B6 should be shown the red card and disqualified and Team A should be awarded a penalty kick.
O2: The goal should not be counted, B6 should be shown the yellow card and required to leave the field of play and Team A should be awarded a penalty kick.
O3: The goal should count, B6 should be shown the red card and disqualified and the game should be restarted with a kickoff by Team B.
O4: The goal should count, B6 should be shown the yellow card and required to leave the field of play and the game should be restarted with a kickoff by Team B.

Q: The referee awards a throw-in to Team A. A14 takes the throw but the ball does not enter the field. Team A should retake the throw-in from the same location. [Rule 15-1-5]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False. Team B should be awarded a throw-in from the same location.

Q: The Team A goalkeeper is dribbling the ball with his feet in his own penalty area when opponent B1 fairly charges and steals the ball. The referee penalizes B1 and awards an indirect kick to Team A. This is correct procedure. [Rule 12-4-2]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: B9 runs towards the ball, which is rolling on the ground near the right goal post. A3 faces B9, with the ball behind her, and extends her arms wide to prevent B9 from running past her to get the ball. A3 does not make physical contact with B9. The ball rolls over the goal line for a goal kick. [Rule 12-5-1]
openA: There is no offense, and a goal kick should be awarded.
O1: A3 is guilty of pushing. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team B.
O2: A3 is guilty of pushing. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team B and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.
O3: A3 is guilty of obstruction. The referee should award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O4: There is no offense, and a goal kick should be awarded.

Q: A thrower with a physical impairment who is limited to one hand may throw in the ball with a sidearm throw. [Rule 15-1- 2]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. As B4 runs towards the ball to take the kick, B5 enters the penalty area before the kick is taken. The referee allows the kick to proceed. [Rule 14-1-3 Penalty]
openA: If the ball enters the goal, retake the kick. If the ball does not enter the goal and the goalkeeper saves the kick, play continues. If the ball does not enter the goal but rebounds into play, restart with an indirect free kick for Team A.
O1: If the ball enters the goal, count the goal and restart play with a kickoff for Team A. If the ball does not enter the goal, retake the kick.
O2: If the ball enters the goal, retake the kick. If the ball does not enter the goal and the goalkeeper saves the kick, play continues. If the ball does not enter the goal but rebounds into play, restart with an indirect free kick for Team A.
O3: Regardless of the outcome, retake the kick.
O4: Regardless of the outcome, award an indirect free kick to Team A.

Q: The goalkeeper touches the ball with her hands after she has received it directly from a throw-in taken by her teammate. The referee shall allow play to continue since the ball was not kicked to her. [Rule 12-7-4]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: While participating in play, one of Team A's seven eligible players has blood on the uniform. The referee directs the player to leave the field and, since a game may not continue with fewer than seven players, forfeits the game to Team B. This is correct procedure. [Rule 3-1-2, Exception]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: It is recommended that substitutes: [Rule 4-1-3]
openA: Wear distinguishing pinnies when warming up outside the team area.
O1: Wear distinguishing pinnies when warming up outside the team area.
O2: Warm up for a minimum of 15 minutes prior to entering the match.
O3: Report to the scorer prior to warming up.
O4: Remain in the team area while warming up.

Q: A knee brace is considered illegal equipment unless the player wearing the knee brace has a medical release at the game site. [Rule 4-2-1f]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Player A14 scores a goal. Even though the player's name is not on the roster submitted by the coach at the start of the game, the referee should allow the goal. [Rule PR 3.1.3 Situation A]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The defending team kicks the ball across the goal line near the corner flag. Because the corner area on that side of the field is muddy, the referee should permit the attacking team to take the corner kick from the other side of the field. [Rule 17-1-3]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Defender B7 handles the ball inside the penalty area, deflecting it to A3, who scores. B7 should be shown the red card and disqualified. [Rule 12-8-1f(13)]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: B9 is tripped by A6. The referee stops play and awards a free kick to Team B. A6 remains at the spot of the foul, between the ball and the goal defended by Team A, arguing that B9 fell over his leg and that there was no trip. [Rule 13-3-1]
openA: The referee should caution A6 and require him to leave the spot of the foul.
O1: The referee should caution A6 and require him to leave the spot of the foul.
O2: The referee should caution A6 for delaying the restart of play and also caution him for dissent. The referee should then disqualify A6 for receiving a second caution.
O3: The referee should ignore A6 and signal for the restart of play.
O4: The referee should move to a spot 10 yards closer to the goal defended by Team A and urge A6 to retreat to that position.

Q: Player A, who is in an offside position, receives the ball directly from a goal kick by Teammate A2. The referee shall declare Player A to be offside. [Rule 11-1-2]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The coach shall be cautioned (yellow card) if the referee discovers that a player entered the game wearing illegal equipment. If any subsequent players enter the game wearing illegal equipment, both the coach and the player will be cautioned. [Rule 4-3]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: A7 receives a caution for a reckless tackle. Before leaving the field, or before a substitute has been beckoned in, A7 slams the ball down in protest. [Rule 12-8-2c; 12-8-1c]
openA: Display a second yellow and then a red card to A7 and not allow a substitute.
O1: Display a red card to A7.
O2: Display a second yellow and then a red card to A7 and allow a substitute.
O3: Display a second yellow and then a red card to A7 and not allow a substitute.
O4: Have A7 leave the field for the first caution and take no further action.

Q: The official signal for a goal scored is:
openA: Pointing to the center of the field.
O1: Blowing the whistle.
O2: Raising both hands above the head.
O3: Stopping the clock.
O4: Pointing to the center of the field.

Q: Player A4 scores a goal. After scoring, A4 goes to the opposing goalkeeper and ridicules him by pointing his finger in the goalkeeper's face. The referee shall disqualify A4 for taunting. [Rule 12-8-2b]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: During inspection of the game balls supplied by the home team, the referees note that the balls do not have the FIFA Authenticating Mark. [Rule 2-2-5 and 2-1]
openA: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the FIFA Authenticating Mark.
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the FIFA Authenticating Mark.
O2: This is not permitted. If neither team has three similar quality game balls with the FIFA Authenticating Mark, the game may begin with balls chosen by the referee from those available.
O3: This is not permitted. If no balls with the fifa Authenticating Mark are available, the game may begin if the home team can provide balls.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: The goalkeeper, before taking a goal kick, moves the ball from the right side of the goal area to the left side of the goal area. If this is deemed a time-wasting ploy, the referee shall stop the clock and caution the goalkeeper. [Rule 16-1-3 and 12- 8-1f(2)]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The position of the players arms is to be considered when judging offside. [Rule 11-1-1b, Note]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Cautioned Player A4 leaves the game and is not replaced. On the next stoppage of play that is not a legal substitution opportunity for Team A, A4 requests to enter the game. The referee should allow A4 to re-enter. [Rule 3-4-1d]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Goalkeeper B1 stops a hard shot by parrying the ball. B1 bends over and picks up the ball before it is touched by an opposing player in the penalty area. The referee should award an indirect free kick to Team A. [Rule 12-7-2]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False. Play should continue.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. The goalkeeper, A1, stands with his back to the ball. This is permitted. [Rule 14-1-3]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: There is no visible clock. The referee will keep the official time on his watch. The referee will stop and start his watch at the times specified in Rule.
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False. The referee may let his watch run continuously and add time to the end of the period as needed.

Q: The home team has painted the goals in its school colors, green and gold. The referee informs the home team's coach that this is illegal because soccer goals shall be white and to correct it before the next contest. This is correct procedure. [Rule 1-4-1; 5-4-1b]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Opposing teams are permitted, by rule, to be on opposite sides of the field and must be directly opposite each other (not diagonally across from each other). [Rule 1-5-3, Exception]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The required minimum distance from the touchline to the team area is 10 feet. [Rule 1-5-1]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: During a pregame inspection, the referee notices that three players' uniforms are faded and will not permit them to play. This is the correct procedure. [Rule PR 4.1.1 Situation E-b]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: During the game, the referee notices that B30 has tape on her ear lobes. Closer observation suggests that there are earrings underneath the tape. The referee should: [Rule 4-3]
openA: Wait until the next stoppage; and since this is the first caution for illegal equipment, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O1: Stop the game, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O2: Wait until the next stoppage; and since this is the first caution for illegal equipment, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O3: Wait until the next stoppage, feel B30s ear lobes to check for earrings under the tape and, if so, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O4: Since the referee did not notice the tape before the game, the referee should take no action.

Q: Player A2 takes a penalty kick during the game. The ball rebounds off the goal post directly to A2 who shoots and scores. The referee shall allow the goal. [Rule 14-1-5]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: An opposing player plays the ball before the ball clears the penalty area on a goal kick. The referee shall order a rekick. [Rule 16-1-2]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Taunting is a disqualification, and the number of players on the field must be reduced. [Rule 12-8-2b]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: During halftime, the referee notices that the visiting team's head coach is showing his players a video of action from the first half on his tablet. [Rule PR 12.8.1 Situation C]
openA: This is permitted.
O1: This is permitted.
O2: This is not permitted.

Q: Goalkeeper A1 is waiting for a high ball to come down in his vicinity. As it reaches him and seeing B9 approaching, he jumps up for the ball with both hands extended. B9 comes running into the area and jumps up for the ball, attempting to head it into the goal. A1 and B9 collide, causing both to fall to the ground. [Rule PR 12.4.4 Situation A(a)]
openA: Neither A1 nor B9 is guilty of any offense. The referee should allow play to continue, unless one or both players are injured.
O1: A1 is guilty of obstruction. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick.
O2: B9 is guilty of an illegal charge. The referee should award Team A an indirect free kick.
O3: B9 is guilty of dangerous play. The referee should award Team A an indirect free kick.
O4: Neither A1 nor B9 is guilty of any offense. The referee should allow play to continue, unless one or both players are injured.

Q: Before the game, the referee observes that all Team B players are wearing pink rubber bands on their wrists. She is informed by the Team B head coach that they are in support of a team members mother who died of breast cancer. The referee should allow Team B players to wear the rubber bands. [Rule 4-2-4 and Play Ruling Situation B]
openA: False. The referee, in the absence of a state association ruling to the contrary, should not allow Team B players to wear the rubber bands.
O1: True
O2: False. The referee, in the absence of a state association ruling to the contrary, should not allow Team B players to wear the rubber bands.

Q: During the game, the home team has a video screen set up in front of its bench, showing the game as seen by a camera in the press box. There is no video screen available to the visiting team. [Rule PR 12.8.1 Situation C]
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: This is permitted.
O2: This is not permitted.

Q: A goal can be scored directly from a corner kick. [Rule 10-1-2e]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Each shinguard must be permanently marked on the front with the NOCSAE seal and height range. [Rule 4-1-1]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Team A has been awarded an indirect free kick 22 yards from the Team B goal. Four Team A players are standing near the ball. A8 taps the top of the ball with his foot. A5 then kicks the ball, which enters the Team B goal without being touched by any other player. [Rule 18-1-1n]
openA: No goal.
O1: Goal.
O2: No goal.

Q: While waiting for a corner kick to be taken by Team B, with Team A ahead, 2-1, in the second half, goalkeeper A1 pushes B7 to the ground from behind. B7 gets up and punches A1 in the face. Both teams then engage in a general brawl. After the fighting has ceased, the referee feels that because of the fight, further disorder will result and because of this, terminates the game. [Rule PR 5.3.2 Situation B]
openA: The referee has authority to terminate the game but does not have authority to declare either team the winner.
O1: If both teams have seven eligible players after the referee has disqualified the appropriate players, the game must be restarted.
O2: The referee has authority to terminate the game and declare Team B the winner, since the Team A player began the fight.
O3: The referee has authority to terminate the game. The 2-1 score for Team A stands as the official score, since more than half the game was played.
O4: The referee has authority to terminate the game but does not have authority to declare either team the winner.

Q: A2, in an offside position, receives a goal kick taken by B1. A2 should be penalized for offside. [Rule 11-1-2]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Team A is winning and repeatedly substitutes to consume time. The official shall order the timer to stop the clock and notify the offending team's coach that continuing to substitute in this manner will be considered unsporting conduct. [Rule 3-6]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The head referee shall instruct the timer to correct the clock as necessary. [Rule 5-3-2i]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Team A kicks off to start the game. Player A1 takes the kickoff and kicks the ball backwards to player A2. The referee shall stop play and award an indirect free kick to Team B. [Rule 8-1-3]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Before the game, the Team A head coach informs the referee that A15 will be wearing a hockey-style mask, due to an injury she received in a game the previous week. [Rule 4-2-8]
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: This is not permitted.
O2: This is not permitted unless A15 can show the referee a doctors permission slip.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is permitted unless the mask has been painted in an objectionable manner.

Q: Team A goalkeeper, after gaining possession of the ball with his/her hands, pushes or rolls the ball along the ground and retrieves or touches the ball with his/her hands. This is illegal. [Rule PR 12.7.1 Situation]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: All permissible artificial limbs must be: [Rule 4-2-5]
openA: Padded with a minimum of 1/2-inch-thick, closed-cell, slow-recovery foam padding.
O1: Covered by a cast.
O2: Covered by a sleeve.
O3: Padded with a minimum of 1/2-inch-thick, closed-cell, slow-recovery foam padding.
O4: Covered with a minimum of 1/2-inch-thick soft material.

Q: While A10 is dribbling towards goal, a substitute in the bench area, B17, throws a water bottle at A5, striking him in the head. The referee stops play, determines that A5 is able to continue to play and disqualifies B17. [Rule 13-2-3c]
openA: The game must be restarted with an indirect free kick by Team A from the location of the ball at the time A5 was struck.
O1: The game must be restarted with a direct free kick by Team A from the spot where A5 was struck.
O2: The game must be restarted with an indirect free kick by Team A from the spot where A5 was struck.
O3: The game must be restarted with a direct free kick by Team A from the location of the ball at the time A5 was struck.
O4: The game must be restarted with an indirect free kick by Team A from the location of the ball at the time A5 was struck.

Q: A7 has fallen down near the ball due to his own clumsiness. There is no opponent near him. While still on the ground, A7 kicks the ball to A12. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. [Rule PR 12.6 Situation D]
openA: False. A7 is not guilty of an offense. Play should continue.
O1: True
O2: False. A7 is not guilty of an offense. Play should continue.

Q: Player A is frustrated with his play and argues with a teammate. He then utters a series of obscenities at this same teammate. The referee shall disqualify Player A. [Rule 12-8-2f]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: Player A is wearing an ankle brace made of soft and yielding material. Player A may legally wear the ankle brace outside the stocking even though the ankle brace is black and the players stockings are white. [Rule 4-2-1g]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: An unlimited number of players may be substituted from the bench except in which of the following situations: [Rule 3-3- 3b; 3-3-2]
openA: When a player is cautioned.
O1: When a goal is scored.
O2: At the start of the second period.
O3: When a player is injured and removed from the field.
O4: When a player is cautioned.

Q: The referees are wearing yellow jerseys. The visiting team is wearing yellow jerseys. The referees must change jerseys. [Rule 5-1-3a]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False. The visiting team must change jerseys.

Q: An identifiable supporter of the home team seated in the designated spectator area is screaming profanities at the nearest assistant referee in disagreement with a decision about offside made by the assistant referee. The referee should: [Rule 5-3-2e]
openA: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate action.
O1: Stop play and direct the spectator to leave the facility.
O2: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate action.
O3: Stop play and inform the spectator that the assistant referees decision was correct.
O4: Allow play to continue and ignore the supporters language.

Q: Player As throw-in lands completely outside the touchline, without having broken the plane of the touchline, and bounds into the field of play. The referee orders a rethrow by Team A. This is a correct decision. [Rule 15-1-5]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The head coach of Team A reaches onto the field to knock down a mid-air pass to B8, who is unmarked but still 45 yards away from the goal. [Rule 12-8-1f(6)]
openA: The coach should be cautioned for unsporting conduct.
O1: The coach should be cautioned for unsporting conduct.
O2: The coach should be dismissed for failing to conduct himself in a responsible manner.
O3: The coachs behavior is outside interference and the referee should restart play with a drop ball.
O4: There is no offense and play should continue.

Q: Bench personnel running on the field and preventing a goal would be an example of: [Rule 12-8-1a]
openA: Misconduct.
O1: Misconduct.
O2: Serious foul play.
O3: A foul.
O4: None of the above.

Q: The game is played with no official scorer available. The substitutes report to the nearest official. [Rule 3-4-1a]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The referee, seeing the assistant referee's flag for offside, waves the flag down as the ball goes directly to the goalkeeper. This is correct procedure. [Rule 5-3-2h]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: At the taking of a corner kick, the defending players must be: [Rule 17-1-2]
openA: 10 yards from the quarter circle.
O1: 10 yards from the ball.
O2: 10 yards from the corner flag.
O3: 10 yards from the quarter circle.
O4: 10 yards from the ball unless they are marking an opponent who is not taking the kick.

Q: A substitute for the team awarded a corner kick may be allowed to enter the game directly from the bench without having to report to the scorer's table. [Rule 3-4-1d]
openA: False
O1: True
O2: False

Q: A team may not substitute an unlimited number of players from the bench when a player is injured and removed from the field. [Rule 3-3-2b]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: The home team and the visiting team are both wearing blue shorts. There is no specific prohibition listed. Since it is not declared illegal, it must be legal. [Rule 4-1-1]
openA: This is permitted.
O1: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing white shorts.
O2: The referee should allow the game to begin but, after the game, should report the situation to the state association.
O3: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing a different color of shorts than the visiting team is wearing.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: The home team coach asks for a 20-minute halftime interval for a parent appreciation ceremony. The visiting team's coach is opposed to this and insists that the interval be only 10 minutes. The referee shall not allow a 20-minute halftime interval. [Rule 7-2-1]
openA: True
O1: True
O2: False

Q: A9 has committed a foul in an unsporting manner. The referee has stopped play and cautioned A9. When the referee approaches the team areas to notify the coaches of the reason for the caution, the Team A head coach says, Ref, you are such a moron that, if you had a brain cell, it would die of loneliness! [Rule 12-8-2f]
openA: The referee should disqualify the Team A head coach for insulting language.
O1: The referee should caution the Team A head coach for dissent.
O2: The referee should disqualify the Team A head coach for insulting language.
O3: The referee should tell the Team A head coach that hes heard enough.
O4: The referee should ignore the Team A head coach and restart play with a direct free kick for Team B.

Q: The home team is wearing apparel under the shorts and shirt that is visible. [Rule 4-1-1d garment.]
openA: It is legal if it is a solid color matching the predominant color of the respective
O1: It is legal if it is a solid color matching the predominant color of the respective garment.
O2: The color of the visible apparel does not matter.
O3: It is legal as long as it doesn't conflict with the color of the visiting team.
O4: It needs to be reported to the state association.

Q: Which of the following is considered legal equipment for players? [Rule 4- 2-9]
openA: A and C.
O1: Goalkeeper with a soft-billed cap.
O2: A hockey goalie-type mask.
O3: Soft-padded headgear.
O4: A and C.

Q: The game officials are observed using headset communication equipment to speak with each other during a match. The use of this equipment is: [Rule 5-1-3f]
openA: Allowed unless the state association has prohibited such equipment.
O1: Prohibited.
O2: Permitted in all cases.
O3: Allowed unless the state association has prohibited such equipment.
O4: Allowed only if both coaches agree.

Q: The game officials are observed using flags with buzzer/beeper capabilities during a match. The use of these flags is: [Rule 5-1-3f]
openA: Allowed unless the state association has expressly prohibited such equipment.
O1: Prohibited.
O2: Permitted in all cases.
O3: Allowed unless the state association has expressly prohibited such equipment.
O4: Allowed only if both coaches agree.

Q: Team A has a kickoff in the first half of play. Player A1 kicks the ball backward to Player A2. The official should: [Rule 8-1-3]
openA: Allow play to continue.
O1: Order the kick to be retaken.
O2: Award a direct free kick to Team B.
O3: Require Team A to retake the kickoff.
O4: Allow play to continue.

Q: A goal may not be scored directly from a: [Rule 10-1-3f]
openA: Kickoff into the kicking team's own goal.
O1: Direct free kick.
O2: Corner kick.
O3: Drop ball.
O4: Kickoff into the kicking team's own goal.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A7 uses several stutter-steps but does not interrupt the approach to the ball. The ball enters the goal. The referee should: [Rule 14-1-4]
openA: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff by the defending team.
O1: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff by the defending team.
O2: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick for Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution A7 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick for Team B.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A3 uses a feint to one direction but does not interrupt the approach to the ball. The ball enters the goal. The referee should: [Rule 14-1-4]
openA: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team.
O1: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team.
O2: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution A7 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.

Q: During inspection of the field, the referees note that there is no spot or other suitable mark in the center of the field. What should be the referee's response? [Rule 1.2.4 SITUATION the home team to correct the situation for future games.]
openA: This is not permitted but the game may begin without it. The referee should notify
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until a suitable mark is made.
O2: This is not permitted but the game may begin without it. The referee should notify the home team to correct the situation for future games.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is not permitted and the referees should create a mark before the game begins.

Q: During their inspection of the field, the referees note that the field has multiple lines of different color and the soccer field areas contrast in color to the other markings. The referees should: [Rule 1-2-1]
openA: Begin the contest as this is permitted by rule.
O1: Inform the head coach to correct the field markings before the contest can begin.
O2: Cancel the contest and inform the state association of the improper markings.
O3: Begin the contest, but inform the state association of the improper markings following the contest.
O4: Begin the contest as this is permitted by rule.

Q: During their inspection of the field, the referees note that the portable goals are not secured, anchored or counterweighted. The home teams head coach says that this is the first time all year that this has been considered a problem. What should be the referee's response? [Rule 1.4.1 SITUATION B begin.]
openA: The goals must be secured, anchored or counterweighted before the game may
O1: The goals must be secured, anchored or counterweighted before the game may begin.
O2: The game may begin without the goals being secured, anchored or counterweighted, but the referees must report this to the appropriate authority.
O3: The game may begin without the goals being secured, anchored or counterweighted but the referees should report this to the home teams head coach and ask that the goals be properly secured for subsequent games.
O4: Since previous referees have allowed games to be played at this site without the goals being secured, anchored or counterweighted, the referees should take no further action.

Q: Which of the following is true if opposing teams choose to be on opposite sides of the field? [Rule 1-5-3 EXCEPTION 1]
openA: The teams may be diagonally across from each other.
O1: The teams must be directly opposite each other.
O2: The teams may be diagonally across from each other.
O3: The teams are not allowed to be on opposite sides.
O4: The teams must make prior arrangements and notify the referee before the game.

Q: Pads on soccer goals: [Rule 1-4-1]
openA: Must be white.
O1: Must be white.
O2: Must contain the NOCSAE seal of approval.
O3: Must cover the entire height of the goal post.
O4: May have the school logo displayed on each pad.

Q: Prior to the game, whether the field is unsafe for play and the game should be canceled is the responsibility of: [Rule 1-7]
openA: The host athletic director.
O1: The visiting coach.
O2: The host athletic director.
O3: The host coach.
O4: The referee.

Q: The home team has painted the goals in its school colors: green and gold. What should the referee do?
openA: Inform the home coach that colored goals are illegal and must be corrected by 1-4-1 the next game, then notify the state association.
O1: Declare the game a forfeit and award the win to the visiting team.
O2: Inform the home coach that colored goals are illegal and must be corrected by the next game, then notify the state association.
O3: Ask the visiting coach if he or she wishes to play the game as scheduled.
O4: Nothing, just play the game.

Q: During inspection of the game balls supplied by the home team, the referees note that the balls do not have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
openA: This is not permitted. If neither team has three similar quality game balls with the 2-1, 2-2-5 NFHS Authenticating Mark, the game may begin with balls chosen by the referee from those available.
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
O2: This is not permitted. If neither team has three similar quality game balls with the NFHS Authenticating Mark, the game may begin with balls chosen by the referee from those available.
O3: This is not permitted. If no balls with the NFHS Authenticating Mark are available, the game may begin if the home team can provide balls with the NCAA or FIFA logo on them.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: A game that must have a winner remains tied after overtime played under the NFHS Sample Tie-Breaking Procedure. The game will now proceed to a penalty kick tie-breaker. The team B coach informs the referee that he now wishes to add a player to his teams roster, a junior varsity team player who has been sitting in the stands during the game. The coach reports that this player is legally and properly equipped. [Rule 3-1-3]
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: The referee must allow this addition to the roster.
O2: This is not permitted.
O3: This is only permitted with the permission of the opposing coach.
O4: Allow the JV player to kick after all others have kicked.

Q: B10 is apparently injured. The referee has stopped play and summoned the Team B trainer onto the field of play. [Rule 3.3.2 SITUATION H]
openA: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instruction.
O1: Neither coach may give coaching instruction to his or her players during the injury stoppage.
O2: The Team A coach may give instruction to the Team A players but the Team B coach must only attend to the injured player.
O3: The Team B coach may only give instructions to the substitute for B10.
O4: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instruction.

Q: B7 is injured and is required to leave the field. Team B has no available substitutes and, therefore, must play short. Several minutes later, B7 has recovered from his injury, and his coach has sent him to report in. What should happen next? [Rule 3-3-7]
openA: B7 may enter the game at the next dead ball.
O1: B7 may enter the game at the next legal substitution opportunity for his team.
O2: B7 may enter the game at the next dead ball.
O3: B7 may enter the game during the run of play.
O4: B7 may not enter the game until he has been cleared by a doctor in writing.

Q: During the cautioning and/or disqualification of bench personnel: [Rule 3-4-1d may be beckoned onto the field by the referee.]
openA: Substitutes who have properly reported before the caution and/or disqualification
O1: Substitutes who have properly reported before the caution and/or disqualification may be beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O2: Only those substitutes who have reported in from the non-offending team may be beckoned onto the field.
O3: No substitutes are permitted at this time.
O4: Any player or bench personnel may substitute at this time.

Q: During the penalty kick, a player is found bleeding and is required to leave the field. [Rule 3-3-3d(2)]
openA: The incoming substitute may not take the penalty kick.
O1: The substitute is allowed to take the penalty kick.
O2: The incoming substitute may not take the penalty kick.
O3: The bleeding player is allowed to take the penalty kick.
O4: The bleeding player does not have to leave the field.

Q: If a team repeatedly substitutes to consume time: [Rule 3-6 team. Repetition may be construed as unsporting conduct.]
openA: The referee will order the timer to stop time and notify the coach of the offending
O1: The referee will take no action.
O2: The referee will allow the substitution, but will admonish the coach.
O3: The referee will stop the time and allow the substitution.
O4: The referee will order the timer to stop time and notify the coach of the offending team. Repetition may be construed as unsporting conduct.

Q: If bench personnel are cautioned or disqualified:
openA: Substitutions from either team who have checked-in prior to the 3-3-3b, 3-3-3c, 3-4-1d caution/disqualification may enter the game.
O1: Substitutions may be made from the bench.
O2: Substitutions from the bench of the non-offending team may enter the game.
O3: Substitutions from either bench may enter the game.
O4: Substitutions from either team who have checked-in prior to the caution/disqualification may enter the game.

Q: Play has been stopped for a foul by A4. The referee has given A4 a caution (yellow card.) As the referee is walking with the player towards the Team A bench to report the caution to the coaches, A4 directs insulting language to the referee. A9, a substitute who is waiting to enter the game for A4, has not been beckoned onto the field by the referee. [Rule 12-8-2f]
openA: The referee should show A4 a red card and not allow A9 to enter the field. 3-3-6,
O1: The referee should ignore A4s statement.
O2: The referee should show A4 a red card and allow A9 to enter the field.
O3: The referee should show A4 a red card and not allow A9 to enter the field.
O4: The referee should show A4 a yellow card, followed by a red card and not allow A9 to enter the game.

Q: Player A14 scores a goal. Even though the player's name is not on the roster submitted by the coach at the start of the game, the referee should: [Rule 3.1.3 SITUATION A]
openA: Disallow the goal as the player is not on the roster.
O1: Disallow the goal as the player is not on the roster.
O2: Allow the goal, have the coach add A14's name to the roster.
O3: Caution A14, restart with a direct free kick.
O4: Caution A14, restart with a drop ball.

Q: The game is played with no official scorer available. [Rule 3-4-1a]
openA: Incoming substitutes shall report directly to the nearest official.
O1: The team is allowed to substitute at any time since there is no official scorer.
O2: Since no official scorer is provided, there will be no substitution allowed.
O3: The home team must provide an official scorer.
O4: Incoming substitutes shall report directly to the nearest official.

Q: The ball has gone out for a throw-in by Team A. While A9 is retrieving the ball, the Team A coach says Sub ref! and instructs A5, who is sitting on the bench, to enter the game for A13. What should be the referee's response? [Rule 3-4-1d area prior to the dead ball.]
openA: Not allow the substitution since player A5 had not reported to the scorer or official
O1: Allow A5 to enter the game during this dead ball.
O2: Not allow the substitution since player A5 had not reported to the scorer or official area prior to the dead ball.
O3: Only allow Team B substitutes to enter.
O4: None of the above.

Q: The referee awards a throw-in for Team B. Before the ball is put into play, the coach for Team B sends a player to the scorer's bench for entry into the game. [Rule 3-4-1d]
openA: The referee does not allow the substitution since the substitute did not report prior to the dead ball.
O1: The referee does not allow the substitution since the substitute did not report prior to the dead ball.
O2: The referee allows the substitution.
O3: The referee only allows the substitution if both teams are subbing.
O4: The referee cautions the substitute for illegal entry.

Q: The home coach presents a roster to the referee which shows the names of all of the players. The roster does not show the names of the coaches or other bench personnel. What should be the referee's response? [Rule 3-1-3]
openA: The game may not begin until the coach provides a complete roster.
O1: The game may not begin until the coach provides a complete roster.
O2: The game may begin if the coach promises to provide a complete roster by the end of the game.
O3: The game may begin. Inclusion of the coaches names on the roster is not required.
O4: The game may begin but the referee should remind the coach that a complete roster is required for future games.

Q: Which of the following is not required to be submitted on a team roster? [Rule 3-1-3]
openA: A player's position.
O1: A player's number.
O2: A player's first name.
O3: A player's last name.
O4: A player's position.

Q: A dark jersey is defined as: [Rule 4-1-1a]
openA: Any color that contrasts with white.
O1: Black.
O2: Any color other than white.
O3: Any color that contrasts with white.
O4: Any color that incorporates black.

Q: All permissible artificial limbs must be: [Rule 4-2-5 padding.]
openA: Padded with a minimum of 1/2-inch-thick, closed-cell, slow-recovery foam
O1: Covered by a cast.
O2: Covered by a sleeve.
O3: Padded with a minimum of 1/2-inch-thick, closed-cell, slow-recovery foam padding.
O4: Covered with a minimum of 1/2-inch-thick soft material.

Q: At the start of the game, the players from both teams have their shirts tucked into their shorts. Seven minutes into the game, the referee notices that A6s shirt is no longer tucked in. [Rule 4.3 SITUATION B]
openA: At the next stoppage, the referee should request that A6 tuck in his shirt.
O1: At the next stoppage, the referee should caution A6s coach because A6 is now illegally equipped and require A6 to leave the field.
O2: At the next stoppage, the referee should require A6 to leave the field to make his equipment proper, but not issue a caution because A6 is improperly equipped.
O3: At the next stoppage, the referee should request that A6 tuck in his shirt.
O4: The referee should ignore this because he will appear too picky by enforcing such a minor rule.

Q: Before the game, the referee observes B4 wearing soft-padded headgear. [Rule 4-2-9]
openA: B4 may participate.
O1: B4 may participate with soft-padded headgear only if a medical release signed by the appropriate medical professional is available.
O2: B4 may not participate with the soft-padded headgear.
O3: B4 may participate.
O4: B4 may participate with the soft-padded headgear only if both coaches agree.

Q: Before the game begins, the head referee must verify with each head coach whether their players are properly and legally equipped. [Rule 5-2-2d(4) equipped.]
openA: It is the head coaches responsibility that their team is properly and legally 4-3,
O1: It is not necessary procedure to verify whether the team is properly and legally equipped.
O2: It is the team captains duty to verify that their team is properly and legally equipped.
O3: It is the head coaches responsibility that their team is properly and legally equipped.
O4: There is no required penalty for improperly and illegally equipped players.

Q: Before the game, the referee observes that all Team B players are wearing pink rubber bands on their wrists. The referee should: [Rule 4.2.9 SITUATION B]
openA: Not allow Team B to wear the rubber bands as they are considered jewelry. 4-2-4,
O1: Wait for the game to begin, then caution each player for improper equipment.
O2: Not allow Team B to wear the rubber bands as they are considered jewelry.
O3: Allow Team B to wear them as they are deemed safe.
O4: Wait for the game to begin, then caution the coach for the improper equipment.

Q: Before the game, the Team A head coach informs the referee that A15 will be wearing a hockey-style mask, due to an injury she received in a game the previous week. [Rule 4-2-8]
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: This is not permitted.
O2: This is not permitted unless A15 can show the referee a doctors permission slip.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is permitted unless the mask has been painted in an objectionable manner.

Q: During the pregame inspection, the official notes that the home team's players are wearing white socks with visible black electrical tape around the top of their socks in honor of a schoolmate who has died. The official should: [Rule 4-1-1b]
openA: Not permit players with black tape to play until it is corrected.
O1: Take no action.
O2: Not permit players with black tape to play until it is corrected.
O3: Not say anything but as soon as the game begins, caution the coach for illegal uniform.
O4: Start the game and as soon as a player wearing black tape plays the ball, stop play, caution the player and restart with an indirect kick.

Q: It is recommended that substitutes: [Rule 4-1-3]
openA: Wear distinguishing pinnies when warming up outside the team area.
O1: Wear distinguishing pinnies when warming up outside the team area.
O2: Warm up for a minimum of 15 minutes prior to entering the match.
O3: Report to the scorer prior to warming up.
O4: Remain in the team area while warming up.

Q: Prior to the game, a player is found to be wearing shinguards that do not contain the NOCSAE seal. [Rule 4-2-1]
openA: Illegal equipment shall not be worn by any player.
O1: The player is allowed to participate with the shinguards.
O2: Illegal equipment shall not be worn by any player.
O3: The coach assures that the shinguards are legal; therefore, the referee allows it.
O4: Both coaches agree that there is no violation and the shinguards are allowed.

Q: Team A is the home team and Team B is the visiting Team. Before the game the referee notices that the home team is wearing a yellow jersey. The referee shall: [Rule 4-1-1a]
openA: Both O1 and O3 are acceptable.
O1: Instruct the home team to put on a solid white jersey.
O2: Terminate the game and declare Team B the winner.
O3: If team A does not have a white jersey, notify the state association and allow the game to be played.
O4: Both O1 and O3 are acceptable.

Q: The goalkeeper must have a number on the back of the jersey and on the front of the jersey or pants. [Rule 4-1-1h(1)]
openA: This is required.
O1: This is required.
O2: The color of the number does not have to contrast with the goalkeeper's uniform.
O3: The number of the goalkeeper is 4 inches in height on the back and front of the uniform.
O4: This is not required.

Q: The home team and the visiting team are both wearing blue shorts. There is no specific prohibition listed. Since it is not declared illegal, it must be legal. [Rule 4-1-1a]
openA: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing a different color of shorts than the visiting team.
O1: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing white shorts.
O2: The referee should allow the game to begin but, after the game, should report the situation to the state association.
O3: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing a different color of shorts than the visiting team.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: The home team is wearing white shirts with yellow piping on the shoulders and sleeves, and all white socks. The home team's head coach reports to the referee that its school could not afford new home shirts this year.
openA: The referee should allow the game to begin. After the game, the referee should 4-1-1a, h report this situation to the state association.
O1: The referee should not allow the game to begin until the home team is wearing shirts that are all white.
O2: The referee should allow the game to begin. After the game, the referee should report this situation to the state association.
O3: The referee should allow the game to begin. However, since the shirts are illegal, the home team's head coach should receive a caution at the first stoppage.
O4: The referee should allow the game to begin. The home team's head coach should be cautioned by the referee at the first stoppage and the referee should report the situation to the state association.

Q: The home team jerseys must be: [Rule 4-1-1a]
openA: Solid white.
O1: Striped.
O2: A light color.
O3: Solid white.
O4: A dark color.

Q: The numbers on Team Bs jerseys are not clearly visible. Team B has no other jersey. The game shall be: [Rule 4.1.1 SITUATION G]
openA: Played and the referee shall notify the state association regarding the jerseys.
O1: Delayed until Team B can secure jerseys with clearly visible numbers.
O2: Played and the referee shall notify the state association regarding the jerseys.
O3: Suspended and rescheduled.
O4: Played providing Team A can provide alternate jerseys for Team B.

Q: Which of following may not be worn on the team jersey? [Rule 4-1-1h(2)]
openA: Premier League patch.
O1: American flag
O2: School emblem.
O3: School name.
O4: Premier League patch.

Q: After a goal is scored: [Rule 5-3-1b position and record the goal scorer.]
openA: The referee will stop the clock, point to the center of the field, move to the kickoff
O1: The referee will stop the clock, point to the center of the field, move to the kickoff position and record the goal scorer.
O2: The referee will notify the coaches of the goal scorer.
O3: The referee is not required to stop the clock.
O4: The referee will point to the center of the field.

Q: An identifiable supporter of the home team seated in the designated spectator area is screaming profanities at the nearest assistant referee in disagreement with a decision about offside made by the assistant referee. The referee should: [Rule 5-3-2e action.]
openA: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate
O1: Stop play and direct the spectator to leave the facility.
O2: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate action.
O3: Stop play and inform the spectator that the assistant referees decision was correct.
O4: Allow play to continue and ignore the supporters language.

Q: B14 takes a shot on goal, with goalkeeper A1 out of position. A3, however, extends her arm into the path of the ball, deflecting it to B9. B9 shoots and the ball enters the goal. [Rule 5.3.1 SITUATION A]
openA: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O1: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O2: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.
O3: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O4: The referee should allow the goal and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.

Q: Pregame conferences shall be conducted by the head referee. [Rule 5-2-2d captains.]
openA: The pregame conference must be attended by the team's head coach and
O1: The opposing captains are the only ones required to attend the pregame conference.
O2: The head referee is not required to hold a pregame conference.
O3: The pregame conference must be attended by the team's head coach and captains.
O4: The pregame conference is the assistant referee's responsibility.

Q: Spectators enter the field and disrupt play. What does the referee have the authority to do? [Rule 5-3-2e]
openA: Terminate or suspend the game.
O1: Stop play and caution the coach of the team that the spectators represent.
O2: Stop play and disqualify the coach of the team that the spectators represent.
O3: Terminate or suspend the game.
O4: None of the above.

Q: Team Bs head coach receives a second caution and is disqualified. The referee shall: [Rule 5-3-1g by a red card.]
openA: Display the yellow card indicating the subsequent caution immediately followed
O1: Display both the yellow and the red card at the same time in the same hand.
O2: Immediately display the red card.
O3: Display the yellow card indicating the subsequent caution immediately followed by a red card.
O4: Display no card but immediately request the coach to leave the vicinity.

Q: The jurisdiction of the officials shall begin: [Rule 5-1-2]
openA: On arrival at the field of play and its immediate surroundings.
O1: No later than 15 minutes prior to the start of the game.
O2: On arrival at the field of play and its immediate surroundings.
O3: As soon as the game starts.
O4: As soon as the referee enters the field of play.

Q: The referee observes a foul, but does not penalize it because she perceives an advantage; however, the advantage does not develop. [Rule 5-3-1d]
openA: The referee will let play continue because advantage was given.
O1: The referee will let play continue because advantage was given.
O2: The referee will stop play caution the player who committed the original foul and re-start with an indirect free kick.
O3: The referee will stop play caution the player who committed the original foul and re-start with a direct free kick.
O4: The referee shall immediately stop play and penalize the original foul.

Q: The referees are wearing yellow jerseys. The visiting team is wearing yellow jerseys. The referee shall: [Rule 5-1-3a]
openA: Change to a jersey of a color distinct from the field players.
O1: Change to a jersey of a color distinct from the field players.
O2: Require the away team to change to a different color jersey.
O3: Begin the contest as this is permitted by rule.
O4: Consult with the head coaches of each team to see if they have an objection.

Q: Which of the following is not a duty of the referee? [Rule 5-4-1a]
openA: Determine the winner of games. 5-3-2,
O1: Instruct the timer to correct the clock when necessary.
O2: Decide matters on which the timer and scorer disagree.
O3: Determine the winner of games.
O4: Make decisions on any points not specifically covered in the rules.

Q: Which statement does not allow an official to caution or disqualify a player? [Rule 5-1-2 play and its immediate surroundings.]
openA: After the game has ended and the official has left the jurisdiction of the field of
O1: During the pregame introduction of players because the game has not started.
O2: During an injury stoppage.
O3: When the clock has stopped following a scored goal.
O4: After the game has ended and the official has left the jurisdiction of the field of play and its immediate surroundings.

Q: Since there is no visible clock available at the game site, the referee shall: [Rule 6-2-3a times specified in Rule 6-2-3a.]
openA: Keep the official time on his or her watch and shall stop and start his watch at the 6-2-1,
O1: Not begin the contest until a visible clock is made available.
O2: Keep the official time on his or her watch and shall stop and start his watch at the times specified in Rule 6-2-3a.
O3: Keep the official time on his or her watch and add time to the end of each period as needed.
O4: Have the home team's coach keep the official time on the bench.

Q: The home team shall provide ball holders for the game. [Rule 6-1-1]
openA: At least two ball holders must be provided by the home team.
O1: This is a requirement or the game cannot be played.
O2: At least two ball holders must be provided by the home team.
O3: At least two ball holders must be provided by the visiting team.
O4: There must be at least four ball holders assigned to the game.

Q: A player is cautioned and the referee orders the clock to be stopped: [Rule 7-4-2]
openA: Time is restarted when the ball is put into play.
O1: The official timer restarts the clock when the cautioned player leaves the field.
O2: Time is restarted when the ball is put into play.
O3: Time is restarted when the referee blows the whistle.
O4: As soon as the substitute enters the field, time is restarted.

Q: If the Sample Overtime Procedures are followed by state association adoption, the interval between the first overtime period and the second overtime period shall be: [Rule 7-3-2]
openA: Two minutes.
O1: No interval time allowed.
O2: Three minutes.
O3: Two minutes.
O4: Five minutes.

Q: The game is only 20 minutes old when Team A coach removes her players from the field because of a dispute with the referee. The coach refuses to continue the game despite the referee's instructions to do so. [Rule 7-5]
openA: The referee shall terminate the game.
O1: The referee shall suspend the game.
O2: The referee shall terminate the game.
O3: The referee shall re-schedule the game.
O4: The referee shall remove the coach and continue to play.

Q: During play a referee awards a drop ball. [Rule 9-2-3]
openA: A drop ball can be awarded to the goalkeeper only.
O1: A drop ball can be awarded to the goalkeeper only.
O2: A drop ball does not have to touch the ground before it is played.
O3: A drop ball must be between two opponents.
O4: A drop ball can be between two team members.

Q: During the course of play near the touchline, the official notes that Player A is running outside the field of play and is playing the ball, which is inside the field of play. [Rule 9-1-2e]
openA: The ball continues to be in play.
O1: The referee shall award an indirect kick for the violation.
O2: The ball continues to be in play.
O3: The referee shall stop play and give the ball back to Team A for a throw-in.
O4: The referee shall award a throw-in to Team B.

Q: The referee inadvertently sounds the whistle. [Rule 9.2.1 SITUATION B]
openA: The referee stops play and awards a dropped ball regardless of possession.
O1: Realizing the error, the referee verbally directs "play on" to the players to continue play.
O2: The referee stops play and awards a dropped ball regardless of possession.
O3: The referee stops play and awards an indirect kick to the team in possession.
O4: The referee should do nothing and allow play to continue.

Q: When the ball is out of play or for a foul, the referee should: [Rule 9-1-3]
openA: Sound the whistle.
O1: Sound the whistle.
O2: Let play continue.
O3: Wait for the assistant official to make the call.
O4: Sound the whistle three times.

Q: The ball goes directly into the opponent's goal from a corner kick. The referee should: [Rule 10-1-2e]
openA: Allow the goal.
O1: Disallow the goal.
O2: Allow the goal only if the ball was played twice before entering the goal.
O3: Allow the goal.
O4: None of the above.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a free kick just outside its own penalty area. B3 takes the free kick and passes back to the goalkeeper, who misplays the pass and has the ball carom off his foot and into the goal.
openA: The proper restart is a corner kick.
O1: The proper restart is a corner kick.
O2: The proper restart is a kickoff for the defending team.
O3: The proper restart is an indirect kick.
O4: The proper restart is a direct kick.

Q: A10 is in an offside position. After receiving a pass from B7, B9 accidentally passes the ball to A10. A10 should be: [Rule 11-1-3]
openA: Penalized for being offside and award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O1: Penalized for being offside and award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O2: Issued a caution for being offside and award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O3: Allowed to continue with play.
O4: Awarded a drop ball.

Q: A2, in an offside position, receives a goal kick taken by B1. The referee shall: [Rule 11-1-2]
openA: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O1: Penalize Team A for A2 being offside.
O2: Only call offside if a goal is scored.
O3: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O4: None of the above.

Q: A player shall be penalized for the following action of the hand and arm: [Rule 12-2]
openA: All of the above.
O1: Handling the ball.
O2: Carrying the ball.
O3: Striking or propelling the ball.
O4: All of the above.

Q: A14 is running toward the goal. Her teammate, A12, kicks the ball toward A14. A14 did not see the ball coming and the ball strikes her in the back of the hand as her hand is at her side. The proper call would be to: [Rule 12-2]
openA: Allow play to continue.
O1: Award an indirect free kick to Team B for incidental contact.
O2: Award a direct free kick to Team B.
O3: Allow play to continue as the handling was incidental but issue a caution to the player at the next stoppage of play.
O4: Allow play to continue.

Q: A9 believes that he has been fouled by B4. The referee allows play to continue. A9 tells his teammate that the referee is an idiot. [Rule 12-8-2f out of play before disqualifying A9 for insulting language.]
openA: The referee may immediately stop play or she may wait until the ball is otherwise
O1: The referee should immediately stop play and caution A9 for dissent.
O2: The referee should immediately stop play and disqualify A9 for insulting language.
O3: The referee may immediately stop play or she may wait until the ball is otherwise out of play before cautioning A9 for dissent.
O4: The referee may immediately stop play or she may wait until the ball is otherwise out of play before disqualifying A9 for insulting language.

Q: A7 fell near the ball due to his own clumsiness. There is no opponent near him. While still on the ground, A7 kicks the ball to A12. The referee should: [Rule 12.6 SITUATION D]
openA: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O1: Award Team B an indirect free kick.
O2: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O3: Caution A7 and award a direct free kick.
O4: Caution A7 at the next stoppage.

Q: Bench personnel running onto the field while the ball is in play is an example of: [Rule 18-1-1y]
openA: Misconduct.
O1: Misconduct.
O2: Serious foul play.
O3: A foul.
O4: Dangerous play.

Q: Defender B7 handles the ball inside the penalty area, deflecting it to A3, who scores. What is the correct procedure: [Rule 12-8-1f(13) B.]
openA: The referee should allow the goal, caution B7 and restart with a kickoff for Team
O1: The referee should disallow the goal, caution B7 and award a penalty kick to Team A.
O2: The referee should allow the goal, disqualify B7 and restart with a kickoff for Team B.
O3: The referee should not allow the goal, disqualify B7 and award a penalty kick to Team A.
O4: The referee should allow the goal, caution B7 and restart with a kickoff for Team B.

Q: During halftime, the referee notices that the visiting team's head coach is showing his players a video of action from the first half on his tablet. [Rule 12.8.1 SITUATION C]
openA: Take no action.
O1: Dismiss the coach.
O2: Take no action.
O3: Report the incidence to the proper authorities.
O4: Caution the coach.

Q: During the game, the assistant referee on the bench side hears the home team's assistant coach talking on his cell phone. When asked, the coach says that his wife is pregnant and he is checking on her condition. [Rule 12-8-1e]
openA: Take no action, this is an allowed use of cell phones.
O1: Caution the coach.
O2: Warn the coach and have her put away her phone.
O3: Confiscate the phone for evidence.
O4: Take no action, this is an allowed use of cell phones.

Q: During the game, the referee hears the home team's head coach using a bull horn to instruct her players on the far side of the field. [Rule 12-8-1e]
openA: Caution the coach.
O1: Caution the coach.
O2: Dismiss the coach.
O3: Take no action.
O4: Report the incident to the proper authorities.

Q: For any delayed, excessive or prolonged act(s) by which a player(s) attempts to focus attention upon himself/herself and/or prohibits a timely restart of the game: [Rule 12-8-1f(12)]
openA: The player shall be cautioned.
O1: The player shall be cautioned.
O2: The referee need not take any action.
O3: The player shall be disqualified (red card).
O4: The player shall be warned.

Q: Player B4 is disqualified for receiving a second caution. The referee should: [Rule 12-8-2 SITUATION I of the misconduct.]
openA: Show a yellow card followed by a red card and notify both coaches of the nature
O1: Allow B12 to substitute for B4 as soon as B4 leaves the field.
O2: Display a red and yellow card simultaneously.
O3: Show only a red card and not a yellow card.
O4: Show a yellow card followed by a red card and notify both coaches of the nature of the misconduct.

Q: When a coach is disqualified from the game and refuses to leave the playing area, the following can occur: [Rule 12-8-3c]
openA: Game is terminated.
O1: Game continues.
O2: Game is terminated.
O3: Game is delayed.
O4: None of the above.

Q: Which of the following is considered unsporting conduct and will result in a caution? [Rule 12-8-1f(10)]
openA: Committing a foul in a reckless manner.
O1: Taunting.
O2: Spitting at an opponent.
O3: Committing a foul in a reckless manner.
O4: Leaving the team area to participate in a fight.

Q: Which of these is true about taunting? [Rule 12-8-2b]
openA: Taunting is a misconduct and requires a caution
O1: Taunting is a misconduct and requires a caution to the offender.
O2: It is not required that the player be disqualified.
O3: Taunting is a misconduct and requires that the offending player be disqualified.
O4: If it is directed at a teammate, it requires no action.

Q: A player has a physical impairment which limits him/her to use only one hand. [Rule 15-1-2 continuous motion.]
openA: The impaired player shall deliver the ball from behind and over the head in one
O1: The player is not allowed to take a throw-in.
O2: The impaired player can make a sidearm throw.
O3: The impaired player may kick the ball into play.
O4: The impaired player shall deliver the ball from behind and over the head in one continuous motion.

Q: If the ball goes in the goal directly from a throw-in from the touchline, the goal is: [Rule 15-1-1]
openA: Not allowed.
O1: Awarded.
O2: Not allowed.
O3: The player is disqualified.
O4: None of the above.

Q: On a throw-in, the ball is in play: [Rule 15-1-4]
openA: When it leaves the hands of the thrower and breaks the plane of the touchline.
O1: When it leaves the hands of the thrower.
O2: When it touches the playing surface.
O3: When it leaves the hands of the thrower and breaks the plane of the touchline.
O4: When it touches a second player.

Q: Player As throw-in lands completely outside the touchline, without having broken the plane of the touchline, and bounds into the field of play. [Rule 15-1-5]
openA: The referee awards a re-throw.
O1: The referee orders a re-throw by Team A since the ball never was put into play.
O2: The referee awards a throw-in to Team B.
O3: The referee allows play to continue.
O4: The referee issues a team caution for delay of game.

Q: The referee awards a throw-in to Team B. B17 runs towards the touchline with the ball, releasing it while she has both feet on the ground, on or behind the touchline. Her momentum, however, causes her to raise her left foot shortly after she releases the ball. [Rule 15-1-2]
openA: Play should continue.
O1: Team A should be awarded a throw-in from the same location.
O2: Team A should be awarded an indirect free kick from the spot on the touchline where B17 raised her foot.
O3: Play should continue.
O4: Play should continue unless B17s momentum causes her to fall.

Q: Which of the following is the defender permitted to do during the throw-in? [Rule 2 yards from the throw-in. 15-1-3]
openA: Stand
O1: Jump to block the throw-in.
O2: Stand on the touchline at the point of the throw-in.
O3: Stand 2 yards from the throw-in.
O4: Impede the throw-in with his arms.

Q: B17 is being replaced on a legal substitution opportunity for her team. What should happen next? [Rule 18-1-1ff the field by the referee.]
openA: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, is beckoned onto
O1: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, takes her position on the field.
O2: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, is beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O3: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, steps onto the field.
O4: B17 is considered to still be a player until she has left the field and the game has been restarted.

Q: An opposing player plays the ball before the ball clears the penalty area on a goal kick. [Rule 16-1-2]
openA: The referee shall warn the opposing player and order a rekick.
O1: The referee shall take no action as this is allowed.
O2: The referee shall warn the opposing player and order a rekick.
O3: The referee shall caution the player and award an indirect kick.
O4: The referee shall award a dropped ball.

Q: Team A takes a shot on goal, which deflects off the referee and goes across the goal line just to the right of the goal. [Rule 16-1-1]
openA: The referee shall award a goal kick to Team B. 9-1-2b,
O1: The referee will award a dropped ball.
O2: The referee will award an indirect kick to Team A.
O3: The referee shall award a goal kick to Team B.
O4: The referee shall award a corner kick.

Q: The goalkeeper, before taking a goal kick, moves the spotted ball from the right side of the goal area to the left side of the goal area. [Rule 16-1-3 the goalkeeper.]
openA: This is allowed.
O1: This is allowed.
O2: The referee shall stop the clock and restart once the ball is put into play.
O3: If this is considered time-wasting, the referee shall award an indirect kick.
O4: If this is deemed a time-wasting ploy, the referee shall caution the goalkeeper.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick: [Rule 14-1-3]
openA: The goalkeeper shall stand on the goal line facing the kicker.
O1: The goalkeeper shall stand on the goal line facing the kicker.
O2: The goalkeeper may stand on the goal line facing the goal.
O3: The goalkeeper may stand on the goal line outside the goal posts.
O4: The goalkeeper may move before the ball is kicked.

Q: If a penalty kick is taken after the expiration of time, the ball is in play until: [Rule 14-1-6]
openA: All of the above.
O1: The momentum of the ball has been spent.
O2: The ball goes out of play.
O3: The ball is touched a second time by the kicker.
O4: All of the above.

Q: If during a penalty kick the kick goes directly over the goal line and there is a violation by the attacking team, the restart is: [Rule Penalty Kick Chart]
openA: Goal kick.
O1: Goal kick.
O2: Retake.
O3: Corner Kick.
O4: Indirect free kick.

Q: If on a penalty kick there is a deflection over the goal line by the goalkeeper and no violation by either team, the restart is a: [Rule Penalty Kick Chart]
openA: Corner kick.
O1: Retake.
O2: Indirect free kick.
O3: Corner kick.
O4: Goal Kick.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. As B4 runs toward the ball to take the kick, A5 enters the penalty area before B4 kicks the ball. The referee should: [Rule 14-1-2 PENALTY]
openA: Allow the play to continue and award a goal if the kick by B4 enters the goal.
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as A enters the penalty area.
O2: Allow the play to continue and award a goal if the kick by B4 enters the goal.
O3: Allow the play to continue and award a goal kick if the kick by B4 goes untouched over the goal.
O4: Allow the play to continue and award a corner kick if the kick by B4 is played by the goalkeeper who pushes the ball over the goal line outside of the goal.

Q: The game officials are observed using headset communication equipment to speak with each other during a match. The use of this equipment is:
openA: Allowed unless the state association has prohibited such equipment. 5-1-3f
O1: Prohibited.
O2: Permitted in all cases.
O3: Allowed unless the state association has prohibited such equipment.
O4: Allowed only if both coaches agree.

Q: A goal may not be scored directly from a:
openA: Drop ball. 10-1-3g
O1: Direct free kick.
O2: Corner kick.
O3: Drop ball.
O4: Goal kick.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A7 uses several stutter-steps but does not interrupt the approach to the ball. The ball enters the goal. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff by the defending team. 14-1-4
O1: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff by the defending team.
O2: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick for Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution A7 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick for Team B.

Q: During their inspection of the field, the referees note that the field has multiple lines of different color and the soccer field areas contrast in color to the other markings. The referees should:
openA: Begin the contest as this is permitted by rule. 1-2-1
O1: Inform the head coach to correct the field markings before the contest can begin.
O2: Cancel the contest and inform the state association of the improper markings.
O3: Begin the contest, but inform the state association of the improper markings following the contest.
O4: Begin the contest as this is permitted by rule.

Q: During inspection of the game balls supplied by the home team, the referees note that the balls do not have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
openA: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
O2: This is not permitted. If neither team has three similar quality game balls with the NFHS Authenticating Mark, the game may begin with balls chosen by the referee from those available.
O3: This is not permitted. If no balls with the NFHS Authenticating Mark are available, the game may begin if the home team can provide balls with the NCAA or FIFA logo on them.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: B10 is apparently injured. The referee has stopped play and summoned the Team B trainer onto the field of play.
openA: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instruction. 3.3.2 SITUATION H
O1: Neither coach may give coaching instruction to his or her players during the injury stoppage.
O2: The Team A coach may give instruction to the Team A players but the Team B coach must only attend to the injured player.
O3: The Team B coach may only give instructions to the substitute for B10.
O4: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instruction.

Q: During the cautioning and/or disqualification of bench personnel:
openA: Substitutes who have properly reported before the caution and/or disqualification may be beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O1: Substitutes who have properly reported before the caution and/or disqualification may be beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O2: Only those substitutes who have reported in from the non-offending team may be beckoned onto the field.
O3: No substitutes are permitted at this time.
O4: Any player or bench personnel may substitute at this time.

Q: During the penalty kick, a player is found bleeding and is required to leave the field.
openA: The incoming substitute may not take the penalty kick. 3-3-3d(2)
O1: The substitute is allowed to take the penalty kick.
O2: The incoming substitute may not take the penalty kick.
O3: The bleeding player is allowed to take the penalty kick.
O4: The bleeding player does not have to leave the field.

Q: For substitutions in the last five minutes of the second period, the referee will:
openA: Take no action.
O1: Take no action.
O2: Allow the substitution for the leading team, but caution the coach.
O3: Stop the time and allow the substitution if the leading team is making a substitution.
O4: Not stop the clock if both teams are substituting.

Q: Play has been stopped for a foul by A4. The referee has stopped the clock and has given A4 a caution (yellow card.) As the referee is walking with the player towards the Team A bench to report the caution to the coaches, A4 directs insulting language to the referee. A9, a substitute who is waiting to enter the game for A4, has not been beckoned onto the field by the referee.
openA: The referee should show A4 a red card and not allow A9 to enter the 3-3-6, 12-8-2f field.
O1: The referee should ignore A4s statement.
O2: The referee should show A4 a red card and allow A9 to enter the field.
O3: The referee should show A4 a red card and not allow A9 to enter the field.
O4: The referee should show A4 a yellow card, followed by a red card and not allow A9 to enter the game.

Q: The home coach presents a roster to the referee which shows the names of all of the players. The roster does not show the names of the coaches or other bench personnel. What should be the referee's response?
openA: The game may not begin until the coach provides a complete roster.
O1: The game may not begin until the coach provides a complete roster.
O2: The game may begin if the coach promises to provide a complete roster by the end of the game.
O3: The game may begin. Inclusion of the coaches names on the roster is not required.
O4: The game may begin but the referee should remind the coach that a complete roster is required for future games.

Q: Which of the following is not required to be submitted on a team roster?
openA: A player's position. 3-1-3
O1: A player's number.
O2: A player's first name.
O3: A player's last name.
O4: A player's position.

Q: A dark jersey is defined as:
openA: Any color that contrasts with white. 4-1-1a
O1: Black.
O2: Any color other than white.
O3: Any color that contrasts with white.
O4: Any color that incorporates black.

Q: Before the game, the referee observes B4 wearing soft-padded headgear.
openA: B4 may participate. 4-2-9
O1: B4 may participate with soft-padded headgear only if a medical release signed by the appropriate medical professional is available.
O2: B4 may not participate with the soft-padded headgear.
O3: B4 may participate.
O4: B4 may participate with the soft-padded headgear only if both coaches agree.

Q: Before the game begins, the head referee must verify with each head coach whether their players are properly and legally equipped.
openA: It is the head coaches responsibility that their team is properly and 4-3, 5-2-2d(4) legally equipped.
O1: It is not necessary procedure to verify whether the team is properly and legally equipped.
O2: It is the team captains duty to verify that their team is properly and legally equipped.
O3: It is the head coaches responsibility that their team is properly and legally equipped.
O4: There is no required penalty for improperly and illegally equipped players.

Q: Before the game, the referee observes that all Team B players are wearing pink rubber bands on their wrists. The referee should:
openA: Not allow Team B to wear the rubber bands as they are considered 4-2-4 jewelry.
O1: Wait for the game to begin, then caution each player for improper equipment.
O2: Not allow Team B to wear the rubber bands as they are considered jewelry.
O3: Allow Team B to wear them as they are deemed safe.
O4: Wait for the game to begin, then caution the coach for the improper equipment.

Q: Before the game, the Team A head coach informs the referee that A15 will be wearing a hockey-style mask, due to an injury she received in a game the previous week.
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: This is not permitted.
O2: This is not permitted unless A15 can show the referee a doctors permission slip.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is permitted unless the mask has been painted in an objectionable manner.

Q: During the pregame inspection, the official notes that the visiting team's players are wearing white socks with visible black electrical tape around the top of their socks in honor of a schoolmate who has died. The official should:
openA: Not permit players with black tape to play until it is corrected. 4-1-1b
O1: Take no action.
O2: Not permit players with black tape to play until it is corrected.
