O3: Not say anything, but as soon as the game begins, caution the coach for illegal uniform.
O4: Start the game and as soon as a player wearing black tape plays the ball, stop play, caution the player and restart with an indirect kick.

Q: It is recommended that substitutes:
openA: Wear distinguishing pinnies when warming up outside the team 4-1-3 area.
O1: Wear distinguishing pinnies when warming up outside the team area.
O2: Warm up for a minimum of 15 minutes prior to entering the match.
O3: Report to the scorer prior to warming up.
O4: Remain in the team area while warming up.

Q: The goalkeeper must have a number on the back of the jersey and on the front of the jersey or pants.
openA: This is required. 4-1-1h(1)
O1: This is required.
O2: The color of the number does not have to contrast with the goalkeeper's uniform.
O3: The number of the goalkeeper is 4 inches in height on the back and front of the uniform.
O4: This is not required.

Q: The home team and the visiting team are both wearing blue shorts. There is no specific prohibition listed. Since it is not declared illegal, it must be legal.
openA: This is permitted. 4-1-1a
O1: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing white shorts.
O2: The referee should allow the game to begin but, after the game, should report the situation to the state association.
O3: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing a different color of shorts than the visiting team.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: The visiting team is wearing white shirts with yellow piping on the shoulders and sleeves, and dark-colored socks. The visiting team's head coach reports to the referee that its school could not afford new visiting team shirts this year.
openA: The referee should allow the game to begin. After the game, the 4.1.1 SITUATION G referee should report this situation to the state association.
O1: The referee should not allow the game to begin until the visiting team is wearing shirts that are all white.
O2: The referee should allow the game to begin. After the game, the referee should report this situation to the state association.
O3: The referee should allow the game to begin. However, since the shirts are illegal, the home team's head coach should receive a caution at the first stoppage.
O4: The referee should allow the game to begin. The visiting team's head coach should be cautioned by the referee at the first stoppage and the referee should report the situation to the state association.

Q: The home team jerseys must be:
openA: A dark color contrasting with white. 4-1-1a
O1: Striped.
O2: A light color.
O3: Solid white.
O4: A dark color contrasting with white.

Q: An identifiable supporter of the home team seated in the designated spectator area is screaming profanities at the nearest assistant referee in disagreement with a decision about offside made by the assistant referee. The referee should:
openA: Stop play and request that the home school administration take 5-3-2e appropriate action.
O1: Stop play and direct the spectator to leave the facility.
O2: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate action.
O3: Stop play and inform the spectator that the assistant referees decision was correct.
O4: Allow play to continue and ignore the supporters language.

Q: B14 takes a shot on goal, with goalkeeper A1 out of position. A3, however, extends her arm into the path of the ball, deflecting it to B9. B9 shoots and the ball enters the goal.
openA: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting 5.3.1 SITUATION A conduct.
O1: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O2: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.
O3: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O4: The referee should allow the goal and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.

Q: Team Bs head coach receives a second caution and is disqualified. The referee shall:
openA: Display the yellow card indicating the subsequent caution 5-3-1g immediately followed by a red card.
O1: Display both the yellow and the red card at the same time in the same hand.
O2: Immediately display the red card.
O3: Display the yellow card indicating the subsequent caution immediately followed by a red card.
O4: Display no card but immediately request the coach to leave the vicinity.

Q: The jurisdiction of the officials shall begin:
openA: On arrival at the field of play and its immediate surroundings. 5-1-2
O1: No later than 15 minutes prior to the start of the game.
O2: On arrival at the field of play and its immediate surroundings.
O3: As soon as the game starts.
O4: As soon as the referee enters the field of play.

Q: The referees are wearing yellow jerseys. The home team is wearing yellow jerseys. The referee shall:
openA: Change to a jersey of a color distinct from the field players. 5-1-3a
O1: Change to a jersey of a color distinct from the field players.
O2: Require the away team to change to a different color jersey.
O3: Begin the contest as this is permitted by rule.
O4: Consult with the head coaches of each team to see if they have an objection.

Q: Which of the following is not a duty of the referee?
openA: Determine the winner of games. 5-3-2, 5-4-1a
O1: Instruct the timer to correct the clock when necessary.
O2: Decide matters on which the timer and scorer disagree.
O3: Determine the winner of games.
O4: Make decisions on any points not specifically covered in the rules.

Q: Since there is no visible clock available at the game site, the referee shall:
openA: Keep the official time on his or her watch and shall stop and start his 6-2-1, 6-2-3a watch at the times specified in Rule 6-2-3a.
O1: Not begin the contest until a visible clock is made available.
O2: Keep the official time on his or her watch and shall stop and start his watch at the times specified in Rule 6-2-3a.
O3: Keep the official time on his or her watch and add time to the end of each period as needed.
O4: Have the home team's coach keep the official time on the bench.

Q: The home team shall provide ball holders for the game.
openA: At least two ball holders must be provided by the home team. 6-1-1
O1: This is a requirement or the game cannot be played.
O2: At least two ball holders must be provided by the home team.
O3: At least two ball holders must be provided by the visiting team.
O4: There must be at least four ball holders assigned to the game.

Q: During play, a referee awards a drop ball.
openA: The referee can decide who should contest the drop ball.
O1: A drop ball can be awarded to the goalkeeper only.
O2: A drop ball does not have to touch the ground before it is played.
O3: A drop ball can be between any number of players.
O4: The referee can decide who should contest the drop ball.

Q: The ball goes directly into the opponent's goal from a corner kick. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal. 10-1-2e
O1: Disallow the goal.
O2: Allow the goal only if the ball was played twice before entering the goal.
O3: Allow the goal.
O4: None of the above.

Q: A2, in an offside position, receives a goal kick taken by B1. The referee shall:
openA: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule. 11-1-2
O1: Penalize Team A for A2 being offside.
O2: Only call offside if a goal is scored.
O3: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O4: None of the above.

Q: A14 is running toward the goal. Her teammate, A12, kicks the ball toward A14. A14 did not see the ball coming and the ball strikes her in the back of the hand as her hand is at her side. The proper call would be to:
openA: Allow play to continue. 12-2
O1: Award an indirect free kick to Team B for incidental contact.
O2: Award a direct free kick to Team B.
O3: Allow play to continue as the handling was incidental but issue a caution to the player at the next stoppage of play.
O4: Allow play to continue.

Q: A7 fell near the ball due to his own clumsiness. There is no opponent near him. While still on the ground, A7 kicks the ball to A12. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule. 12.6 SITUATION D
O1: Award Team B an indirect free kick.
O2: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O3: Caution A7 and award a direct free kick.
O4: Caution A7 at the next stoppage.

Q: During the game, the assistant referee on the bench side hears the home team's assistant coach talking on his cell phone. When asked, the coach says that his wife is pregnant and he is checking on her condition.
openA: Take no action, this is an allowed use of cell phones.
O1: Caution the coach.
O2: Warn the coach and have her put away her phone.
O3: Confiscate the phone for evidence.
O4: Take no action, this is an allowed use of cell phones.

Q: A player has a physical impairment which limits him/her to use only one hand.
openA: The impaired player shall deliver the ball from behind and over the 15-1-2 head in one continuous motion.
O1: The player is not allowed to take a throw-in.
O2: The impaired player can make a sidearm throw.
O3: The impaired player may kick the ball into play.
O4: The impaired player shall deliver the ball from behind and over the head in one continuous motion.

Q: On a throw-in, the ball is in play:
openA: When it leaves the hands of the thrower and breaks the plane of the 15-1-4 touchline.
O1: When it leaves the hands of the thrower.
O2: When it touches the playing surface.
O3: When it leaves the hands of the thrower and breaks the plane of the touchline.
O4: When it touches a second player.

Q: The referee awards a throw-in to Team B. B17 runs towards the touchline with the ball, releasing it while she has both feet on the ground, on or behind the touchline. Her momentum, however, causes her to raise her left foot shortly after she releases the ball.
openA: Play should continue. 15-1-2
O1: Team A should be awarded a throw-in from the same location.
O2: Team A should be awarded an indirect free kick from the spot on the touchline where B17 raised her foot.
O3: Play should continue.
O4: Play should continue unless B17s momentum causes her to fall.

Q: B17 is being replaced on a legal substitution opportunity for her team. What should happen next?
openA: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, is 18-1-1gg beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O1: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, takes her position on the field.
O2: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, is beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O3: B17 is considered to still be a player until her replacement, B12, steps onto the field.
O4: B17 is considered to still be a player until she has left the field and the game has been restarted.

Q: An opposing player plays the ball before the ball clears the penalty area on a goal kick.
openA: The referee shall warn the opposing player and order a rekick. 16-1-2
O1: The referee shall take no action as this is allowed.
O2: The referee shall warn the opposing player and order a rekick.
O3: The referee shall caution the player and award an indirect kick.
O4: The referee shall award a dropped ball.

Q: Player A10 who is not on the roster scores a goal. The referee should:
openA: Disallow the goal and caution A10 for illegal substitution
O1: Add A10 to the roster and allow the goal.
O2: Add A10 to the roster but disallow the goal.
O3: Add A10 to the roster, allow the goal and caution Team A coach.
O4: Disallow the goal and caution A10 for illegal substitution.

Q: The home team arrives for a contest wearing pink jerseys and socks.
openA: This is legal. 4-1-1a
O1: This is legal.
O2: This a illegal and the game shall not be played until corrected.
O3: This is illegal, the head coach is cautioned for illegal uniforms and the game shall not be played until corrected.
O4: This is illegal and the head coach should be cautioned and the game shall be played.

Q: Head coverings worn for medical/cosmetic or religious reasons are permitted provided:
openA: All of the above. 4-2-10
O1: The covering is not abrasive, hard or dangerous to another player.
O2: The covering is highly unlikely to come off during play.
O3: Prior approval by the state association or delegate is given.
O4: All of the above.

Q: The home team is wearing solid blue jerseys and socks, but three members of the team are wearing a white, long- sleeve shirt under their jersey.
openA: This is illegal and must be corrected
O1: This is illegal and must be corrected before they are allowed to participate.
O2: This is legal.
O3: This is illegal as not every home team player is wearing a white long-sleeve shirt under her jersey.
O4: This is illegal as the visiting team is wearing white jerseys.

Q: Home team A is wearing blue jerseys and socks. A1 is wearing a white long-sleeve undershirt, A2 is wearing visible black compression shorts and A3 is wearing a blue long-sleeve undershirt.
openA: Illegal. Visible apparel worn under the jersey shall be of a similar 4-1-1d,e length, all alike and of a solid color.
O1: Illegal. Visible apparel worn under the jersey shall be of a similar length, all alike and of a solid color.
O2: This is legal.
O3: Illegal as visible apparel does not match the predominant color of the uniform.
O4: Illegal as compression shorts do not match the color of the uniform shorts.

Q: At the opening kickoff, A1 enters B's side of the field in order to kick the ball backward to A2.
openA: Illegal as all players must be on their team's half of the field at kickoff.
O1: Illegal as all players must be on their team's half of the field at kickoff.
O2: This is legal.
O3: Illegal. A rekick should be taken.
O4: Illegal. An indirect kick is awarded to Team B.

Q: A2 in the penalty area is advancing the ball toward his opponent's goal with an obvious goal-scoring opportunity. B3 grabs A2's shirt and A2 does not score a goal.
openA: Award Team A a penalty kick and disqualify B3 for denying an 12-8-2d(3) obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O1: Award Team A a penalty kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O2: Award Team A a penalty kick.
O3: Award Team A a penalty kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O4: Award Team A a corner kick.

Q: During active play, Team B's coach enters the playing field to argue a call with the official and interferes with active play.
openA: Award Team A a direct kick from the point of the infraction. 13-2-1j
O1: Award Team A a direct kick from the point of the infraction.
O2: Award Team A an indirect kick from the point of the infraction.
O3: Resume play with a drop ball.
O4: Award Team A an indirect kick from where the ball was when the referee stopped play.

Q: During an inspection of the field, the referees note that the team areas are not marked. What is the correct procedure?
openA: Both O1 and O3
O1: The referee should notify the state association.
O2: The game will not start until the team areas are properly marked.
O3: The game will begin without the proper markings.
O4: Both O1 and O3

Q: During inspection of the field, the referees note that the corner flags are not orange. What should be the referee's response?
openA: This is permitted. 1-3
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until orange corner flags are provided.
O2: This is not permitted but the game may begin with corner flags that are not orange. The referee should notify the home team to correct the situation for future games.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: Since the corner flags are not the proper color, they should be removed before the game begins.

Q: Due to inclement weather, both coaches agree to shorten the periods of the game. This may be done:
openA: Only before the game begins.
O1: Only before the game begins.
O2: Only during the first period.
O3: Only after one half of the game has been played.
O4: Before the game begins or before the beginning of the second half.

Q: Which of the following is an NFHS Official Soccer Signal?
openA: Starting the clock.
O1: Holding.
O2: Tripping.
O3: Spitting.
O4: Starting the clock.

Q: The official signal for a goal scored is:
openA: Pointing to the center of the field.
O1: Blowing the whistle.
O2: Raising both hands above the head.
O3: Stopping the clock.
O4: Pointing to the center of the field.

Q: At the taking of a corner kick, the defending players must be:
openA: 10 yards from the ball. 17-1-2
O1: 10 yards from the ball.
O2: 10 yards from the corner flag.
O3: 10 yards from the quarter circle.
O4: 10 yards from the ball unless they are marking an opponent who is not taking the kick.

Q: The referee awards a throw-in to Team A. A 14 takes the throw, but the ball hits the ground outside the touchline before entering the field. The referee should:
openA: Allow Team A to retake the throw.
O1: Allow play to continue, ball is in play.
O2: Allow Team A to retake the throw.
O3: Allow the throw-in to Team B from the same location.
O4: Administer a drop ball at the spot where the ball touched the ground.

Q: The referee awards a throw-in to Team B. B7 takes the throw-in, and as he throws the ball in, the ball spins just as it is released. The throw-in lands outside the touchline. The referee should:
openA: Award a throw-in to Team B.
O1: Award a throw-in to Team A at the original spot of the throw-in because the throw-in by B7 was spinning.
O2: Award a throw-in to Team A at the spot where the ball landed because the throw-in by B7 did not enter the field.
O3: Award a throw-in to Team A at the original spot of the throw-in because the throw-in by B7 did not enter the field.
O4: Allow Team B to retake the throw-in because the throw-in by B7 did not enter the field.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. As B4 runs towards the ball to take the kick, B9, B7 and A5 enter the penalty area. The referee allows the kick to proceed.
openA: Regardless of the outcome, retake the kick. 14-1-2 PENALTY
O1: If the ball enters the goal, restart play with a kickoff for Team A.
O2: If the ball does not enter the goal, retake the kick.
O3: Regardless of the outcome, retake the kick.
O4: The referee should not allow the kick to be taken and should caution the Team B players who encroached.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. The goalkeeper, A1, stands with his back to the ball. The referee shall:
openA: Require the goalkeeper to face the kicker. 14-1-3
O1: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O2: Require the goalkeeper to face the kicker.
O3: Suspend the contest until the goalkeeper agrees to face the kicker.
O4: Declare a forfeit.

Q: A9 believes that he has been fouled by B4. The referee allows play to continue. A9 spits at the referee. If the referee stops play immediately, the referee should:
openA: Display a red card to A9 and restart play with an indirect kick. 13-2-2m
O1: Display a yellow card to A9 and restart play with a direct kick.
O2: Display a red card to A9 and restart play with an indirect kick.
O3: Display a red card to A9 and restart play with a direct kick.
O4: Display yellow card and restart with an indirect kick.

Q: An indirect free kick is awarded to Team B. A player from Team A refuses to move the required 10 yards and then kicks the ball away.
openA: The referee shall caution the player from Team A and the restart is 13-3-1 PENALTY the indirect free kick that was awarded to Team B.
O1: A direct free kick should be awarded to Team B.
O3: The referee shall caution the player from Team A and the restart is the indirect free kick that was awarded to Team
O4: The referee shall issue a red card for taunting and award an indirect kick.

Q: B9 is tripped by A6. The referee stops play and awards a free kick to Team B. A6 and other Team A players move slowly to form a defensive wall. Without waiting for the Team A players to be at least 10 yards from the ball, B5's kick strikes the arm of A8 whose arm is stationary and in a natural playing position.
openA: Play should continue.
O1: Play should continue.
O2: The referee should stop play, caution A8, require him to leave the field and restart play with a direct free kick from the spot of the previous kick by Team A.
O3: The referee should stop play, caution A8, require him to leave the field and restart play with an indirect free kick from the spot where A8 contacted the ball.
O4: The referee should caution A8 before B5 takes the kick.

Q: B9 is tripped by A6. The referee stops play and awards a free kick to Team B. A6 remains at the spot of the foul, between the ball and the goal defended by Team A, arguing that B9 fell over his leg and that there was no trip.
openA: The referee should caution A6 and require him to leave spot of the foul.
O1: The referee should caution A6 and require him to leave spot of the foul.
O2: The referee should caution A6 for delaying the restart of play and also caution him for dissent. The referee should then disqualify A6 for receiving a second caution.
O3: The referee should ignore A6 and signal for the restart of play.
O4: The referee should move to a spot 10 yards closer to the goal defended by Team A and urge A6 to retreat to that position.

Q: While A10 is dribbling towards goal, a substitute in the bench area, B17, throws a water bottle at A5, striking him in the head. The referee stops play, determines that A5 is able to continue to play and disqualifies B17.
openA: The game must be restarted with an indirect free kick by Team A 13-2-3c from the location of the ball at the time A5 was struck.
O1: The game must be restarted with a direct free kick by Team A from the spot where A5 was struck.
O2: The game must be restarted with an indirect free kick by Team A from the spot where A5 was struck.
O3: The game must be restarted with a direct free kick by Team A from the location of the ball at the time A5 was struck.
O4: The game must be restarted with an indirect free kick by Team A from the location of the ball at the time A5 was struck.

Q: The referee notices Player A has a broken knee brace. This player is improperly equipped. The referee should:
openA: All of the above. 4-2
O1: Allow the player to fix it if it is immediately correctable.
O2: Allow the player to leave the field and allow a substitute.
O3: Allow the player to leave the field without replacement, and then re-enter at the next dead ball if an official is satisfied that the equipment is in order.
O4: All of the above.

Q: A team with fewer than 11 players, but at least 7 players, may have an additional player enter the game:
openA: At the next dead ball. 3-3-8
O1: At the next substitution opportunity for the late arriving player.
O2: At the next dead ball.
O3: During the run of play.
O4: Only at the beginning of the next half.

Q: A6 has banged heads with an opponent while trying to head a high ball. The referee has stopped play and has determined that A6 has the signs of a possible concussion. The referee requires A6 to leave the field and informs his coach that he may have suffered a concussion. There is no state association rule about concussions beyond that contained in the NFHS rules book.
openA: The referee may allow A6 to return to the game if the coach 3-3-2b(3) indicates appropriate medical personnel has cleared the player.
O1: The referee should not allow A6 to return to the game after being cleared by an appropriate health-care professional.
O2: The referee may allow A6 to return to the game if the coach indicates appropriate medical personnel has cleared the player.
O3: The referee should allow A6 to return to the game if his coach has him report in per 3-4-1.
O4: The referee should not allow A6 to return until the opponent is able to return.

Q: Cautioned Player A4 leaves the game and is not replaced. When can A4 re-enter the game:
openA: At Team A's next legal opportunity to substitute. 3-3-3b(2)
O1: At any stoppage.
O2: At Team A's next legal opportunity to substitute.
O3: During the run of play.
O4: A4 does not have to leave the game.

Q: During the game, the referee notices that B30 has tape on her ear lobes. Closer observation indicates that there are earrings underneath the tape. The referee should:
openA: Wait until the next stoppage; and since this is the first caution for 4-3, 18-1-1t illegal equipment, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O1: Stop the game, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O2: Wait until the next stoppage; and since this is the first caution for illegal equipment, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O3: Wait until the next stoppage, feel B30s ear lobes to check for earrings under the tape and, if so, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O4: Since the referee did not notice the tape before the game, the referee should take no action.

Q: During the course of play near the touchline, the official notes that Player A is running outside the field of play and is playing the ball, which is inside the field of play.
openA: The ball continues to be in play. 9-1-2e
O1: The referee shall award an indirect kick for the violation.
O2: The ball continues to be in play.
O3: The referee shall stop play and give the ball back to Team A for a throw-in.
O4: The referee shall award a throw-in to Team B.

Q: The referee inadvertently sounds the whistle.
openA: The referee stops play and awards a dropped ball regardless of 9-2-1c possession.
O1: Realizing the error, the referee verbally directs "play on" to the players to continue play.
O2: The referee stops play and awards a dropped ball regardless of possession.
O3: The referee stops play and awards an indirect kick to the team in possession.
O4: The referee should do nothing and allow play to continue.

Q: When the ball is out of play or for a foul, the referee should:
openA: Sound the whistle. 9-1-3
O1: Sound the whistle.
O2: Let play continue.
O3: Wait for the assistant official to make the call.
O4: Sound the whistle three times.

Q: A player is cautioned and the referee orders the clock to be stopped:
openA: Time is restarted when the ball is put into play. 7-4-2
O1: The official timer restarts the clock when the cautioned player leaves the field.
O2: Time is restarted when the ball is put into play.
O3: Time is restarted when the referee blows the whistle.
O4: As soon as the substitute enters the field, time is restarted.

Q: The game is only 20 minutes old when Team A coach removes her players from the field because of a dispute with the referee. The coach refuses to continue the game despite the referee's instructions to do so.
openA: The referee shall terminate the game. 7-5
O1: The referee shall suspend the game.
O2: The referee shall terminate the game.
O3: The referee shall re-schedule the game.
O4: The referee shall remove the coach and continue to play.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a free kick just outside its own penalty area. B3 takes the free kick and passes back to the goalkeeper, who misplays the pass and has the ball carom off his foot and into the goal. The proper restart is:
openA: A corner kick.
O1: A corner kick.
O2: A kickoff for the defending team.
O3: An indirect kick.
O4: A direct kick.

Q: Which statement results in a goal?
openA: Goalkeeper A1 catches a shot on goal by Team B. In preparing to 10-1-1 throw the ball to a teammate, Goalkeeper A slips and drops the ball which lands entirely across the goal line and between the goalposts.
O1: During a goal kick, Goalkeeper A1 takes the kick and the ball deflects off a player from Team B who was inside the penalty area and the ball deflects into the goal.
O2: Goalkeeper A1 catches a shot on goal by Team B. In preparing to throw the ball to a teammate, Goalkeeper A slips and drops the ball which lands on the goal line between the goalposts before picking the ball up again.
O3: During a goal kick, Goalkeeper A1 takes the kick and the ball deflects off a player from his/her own team who was inside the penalty area and the ball deflects into the goal.
O4: Goalkeeper A1 catches a shot on goal by Team B. In preparing to throw the ball to a teammate, Goalkeeper A slips and drops the ball which lands entirely across the goal line and between the goalposts.

Q: During an attack by Team A, A4 is laying injured on the ground in an offside position. A3 scores an apparent goal while A4 is in the offside position.
openA: Allow the goal as A4 was not involved in active play. 11-1-4
O1: Disallow the goal and penalize A4 for being offside.
O2: Disallow the goal and award a goal kick to Team B.
O3: Allow the goal, but caution A4 for an unsporting act.
O4: Allow the goal as A4 was not involved in active play.

Q: Player A2 deliberately plays the ball to player B9 who is in an offside position. B9 should be:
openA: Allowed to continue to play, no infraction. 11-1-4
O1: Cautioned for being offside at the next stoppage in play but allow play to continue.
O2: Penalized for being offside.
O3: Allowed to continue to play, no infraction.
O4: Award an indirect free kick to Team A.

Q: Team A has a kickoff in the first half of play. Player A1 kicks the ball backward to Player A2. The official should:
openA: Allow play to continue. 8-1-3
O1: Order the kick to be retaken.
O2: Award a direct free kick to Team B.
O3: Require Team A to retake the kickoff.
O4: Allow play to continue.

Q: A player shall be disqualified (red card) for:
openA: All of the above. 12-8-2d
O1: Disproportionate and unnecessary force against an opponent while playing the ball.
O2: Deliberately handling the ball (other than the goalkeeper) attempting to prevent a goal and the goal is not scored.
O3: Committing a foul, attempting to deny an obvious goal-scoring opportunity, and the goal is not scored.
O4: All of the above.

Q: A player shall be disqualified, without caution, by the official when he or she has completed the following action:
openA: Flagrantly fouls the goalkeeper who is in possession of the ball. 12-4-2a
O1: Hand ball.
O2: Kicks the ball out of bounds.
O3: Flagrantly fouls the goalkeeper who is in possession of the ball.
O4: Fakes an injury.

Q: A7 and A9 have both fallen to the ground in the vicinity of the ball. While still on the ground, A9 attempts to kick the ball to A13.
openA: A9 is not guilty of any offense. Play should continue.
O1: A9 is guilty of dangerous play. The referee should award team B an indirect free kick.
O2: A9 is guilty of dangerous play. The referee should apply advantage and allow play to continue.
O3: A9 is guilty of kicking. The referee should award team B a direct free kick.
O4: A9 is not guilty of any offense. Play should continue.

Q: A9 scores a goal to make the score 1-0 with 1:30 left in the game. He runs toward the portion of the spectators dominated by his schools supporters, removes his shirt and waves it above his head.
openA: A9 is guilty of an excessive act that focuses attention on himself. 12-8-1f(12), 12-8-1 The referee should caution A9. SITUATION B (c)
O1: A9 is guilty of an excessive act that focuses attention on himself. The referee should caution A9.
O2: A9 is guilty of an excessive act that focuses attention on himself. The referee should disqualify A9.
O3: A9 is guilty of taunting. The referee should disqualify A9.
O4: A9 is not guilty of an offense. Play should restart with a Team B kickoff.

Q: B9 takes a throw-in, which his goalkeeper, B1, traps with his feet. B1 then dribbles the ball into the penalty area and picks it up with his hands in order to punt the ball. The officials should:
openA: Award an indirect free kick to Team A. 12-7-3 SITUATION B
O1: Award a penalty kick to Team A for handling by B1.
O2: At the next stoppage of play issue a caution to B1.
O3: Award an indirect free kick to Team A.
O4: Allow play to continue as there is no violation.

Q: Bench personnel running onto the field while the ball is in play is an example of:
openA: Misconduct. 18-1-1z
O1: Misconduct.
O2: Serious foul play.
O3: A foul.
O4: Dangerous play.

Q: During halftime, the referee notices that the visiting team's head coach is showing his players a video of action from the first half on his tablet. What action should be taken?
openA: Take no action. 12-8-1 SITUATION C
O1: Dismiss the coach.
O2: Take no action.
O3: Report the incident to the proper authorities.
O4: Caution the coach.

Q: During active play, Team B's coach enters the playing field to argue a call with the official, but does not interfere with active play.
openA: Award Team A an indirect kick from where the ball was when the 13-2-3a referee stopped play.
O1: Award Team A a direct kick from the point of the infraction.
O2: Award Team A an indirect kick from the point of the infraction.
O3: Resume play with a drop ball.
O4: Award Team A an indirect kick from where the ball was when the referee stopped play.

Q: At the taking of a tie-breaking kick from the penalty mark, goalkeeper A1 deflects the kicked ball. As he celebrates, the balls momentum causes it to strike the ground and spin into the goal. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal. 14-1-6
O1: Disallow the goal as it happened after the goalkeeper's initial touch.
O2: Allow the goal.
O3: Have the kicker retake the kick.
O4: Allow the goal and caution the goalkeeper for the celebration.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick:
openA: The goalkeeper shall stand on the goal line facing the kicker. 14-1-3
O1: The goalkeeper shall stand on the goal line facing the kicker.
O2: The goalkeeper may stand on the goal line facing the goal.
O3: The goalkeeper may stand on the goal line outside the goal posts.
O4: The goalkeeper may move before the ball is kicked.

Q: A throw-in by Player A goes directly to her own goalkeeper, who catches the ball with her hands. The referee should:
openA: Award an indirect free kick to the opponent. 12-7-4 PENALTY
O1: Take no action as this is allowed.
O2: Award an indirect free kick to the opponent.
O3: Retake the throw-in.
O4: Award a throw-in to the opposing team.

Q: A2 is advancing the ball toward the opponent's goal with an obvious goal-scoring opportunity. B3, who is attempting to play the ball, fouls A2, who is outside the penalty area and does not score a goal.
openA: Award Team A a direct kick and disqualify B3 for denying an 12-8-2d(3) obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O1: Award Team A a penalty kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O2: Award Team A a penalty kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O3: Award Team A a direct kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O4: Award Team A a direct kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.

Q: Which of these is true about taunting?
openA: Taunting is a misconduct and requires a caution.
O1: Taunting is a misconduct and requires a caution to the offender.
O2: It is not required that the player be disqualified.
O3: Taunting is a misconduct and requires that the offending player be disqualified.
O4: If it is directed at a teammate, it requires no action.

Q: Which of the following is considered unsporting conduct and will result in a caution?
openA: Committing a foul in a reckless manner. 12-8-1f(10)
O1: Taunting.
O2: Spitting at an opponent.
O3: Committing a foul in a reckless manner.
O4: Leaving the team area to participate in a fight.

Q: When a coach is disqualified from the game and refuses to leave the playing area, the following can occur:
openA: Game is terminated.
O1: Game continues.
O2: Game is terminated.
O3: Game is cancelled.
O4: None of the above.

Q: The referee stops play for dangerous play, which is an act likely to cause injury to self, opponent or teammate.
openA: The penalty is an indirect free kick for the opposing team. 12-6
O1: The penalty is an indirect free kick for the opposing team.
O2: The penalty for the infraction is a direct free kick.
O3: The referee must award a drop ball.
O4: Dangerous play is considered a foul and a direct free kick is awarded to the opposing team.

Q: The visiting team arrives for a contest wearing light gray jerseys and socks.
openA: This is illegal and the visiting team must change prior to play.
O1: This is illegal and the visiting team must change prior to play.
O2: This is legal.
O3: The visiting team must change to an all-white jersey and socks if possible. If it is not possible to correct the problem, the game shall be played and the state association notified.
O4: This is illegal and the head coach should be cauitioned and the game shall be played.

Q: Visiting Team B is wearing white jerseys and socks. B1 is wearing a black long-sleeve undershirt, B2 is wearing black tights, and B3 is wearing a black arm sleeve.
openA: Illegal. Visible apparel does not match the predominant color of the uniform.
O1: B3 is wearing illegal equipment as arm sleeves are not allowed.
O2: This is legal.
O3: Illegal. Visible apparel does not match the predominant color of the uniform.
O4: Illegal as visible undergarments are not all alike.

Q: Which of following may not be worn on the team jersey?
openA: Premier League patch. 4-1-1h(2)
O1: American flag.
O2: School emblem.
O3: School name.
O4: Premier League patch.

Q: Which of the following is considered legal equipment for players?
openA: A and C. 4-2-1 EXCEPTION 2, 4-2-9
O1: Goalkeeper with a soft-billed cap.
O2: A hockey goalie-type mask.
O3: Soft-padded headgear.
O4: A and C.

Q: If visible arm sleeves and/or leg sleeves are worn:
openA: They must be a similar length, all alike in a solid color matching the predominant 4-1d color of the respective garment.
O1: They can be of any color as long as the team is wearing the same color and any length as long as an individual has the same length on each arm.
O2: They can be of any length and any color, and must not conflict with the other team.
O3: They must be a similar length, all alike in a solid color matching the predominant color of the respective garment.
O4: Cannot be worn at all.

Q: An official arrives at the field and is told by the head referee that he/she will be using headsets for communications during the match. No action concerning the use of electronic communication equipment by referees has been taken by the respective state association. The official should:
openA: Use the equipment as it has not been prohibited by the state association. 5-1-3f
O1: Refuse to use such equipment as it is illegal.
O2: Use the equipment as directed but report the head referee to the state association for using illegal communication equipment.
O3: Use the equipment as it has not been prohibited by the state association.
O4: Only use the equipment if both coaches agree.

Q: Indirect free kicks for offside are taken from:
openA: The spot where the offending player interfered with play or where the player 13-1-2 interfered with an opponent or gained an advantage by being in that position.
O1: The spot where the offside player was when the assistant referee raised the flag.
O2: The spot where the offending player interfered with play or where the player interfered with an opponent or gained an advantage by being in that position.
O3: The spot where the offside player touches the ball.
O4: The spot where the ball was passed.

Q: During inspection of the field, the referees note that there is no spot or other suitable mark in the center of the field. What should be the referee's response?
openA: This is not permitted but the game may begin without it. The referee should 1-2-4 SITUATION notify the home team to correct the situation for future games.
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until a suitable mark is made.
O2: This is not permitted but the game may begin without it. The referee should notify the home team to correct the situation for future games.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is not permitted and the referees should create a mark before the game begins.

Q: A game that must have a winner remains tied after overtime played under the NFHS Sample Tie-Breaking Procedure. The game will now proceed to a penalty kick tie-breaker. The team B coach informs the referee that he now wishes to add a player to his teams roster, a junior varsity team player who has been sitting in the stands during the game. The coach reports that this player is legally and properly equipped.
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: The referee must allow this addition to the roster.
O2: This is not permitted.
O3: This is only permitted with the permission of the opposing coach.
O4: Allow the JV player to kick after all others have kicked. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: A team with fewer than 11 players, but at least 7 players, may have an additional player enter the game:
openA: At the next dead ball. 3-3-8
O1: At the next substitution opportunity for the late arriving player.
O2: At the next dead ball.
O3: During the run of play.
O4: Only at the beginning of the next half.

Q: A22 receives his first caution and is required to leave the field.
openA: Either team may substitute an unlimited number provided they report to the 3-3-3b(1) scorer's table or nearest official and are beckoned on.
O1: Only Team A may substitute for A22.
O2: Only Team A may substitute an unlimited number provided they report to the scorer's table or nearest official and are beckoned on.
O3: Either team may substitute an unlimited number provided they report to the scorer's table or nearest official and are beckoned on.
O4: Only Team B may substitute.

Q: During the game, the referee notices that B30 has tape on her ear lobes. Closer observation indicates that there are earrings underneath the tape. The referee should:
openA: Wait until the next stoppage; and since this is the first caution for illegal 4-3, 18-1-1t equipment, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O1: Stop the game, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O2: Wait until the next stoppage; and since this is the first caution for illegal equipment, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O3: Wait until the next stoppage, feel B30s ear lobes to check for earrings under the tape and, if so, caution the Team B head coach and require B30 to leave the game.
O4: Since the referee did not notice the tape before the game, the referee should take no action.

Q: A player who is illegally equipped and whose coach is cautioned for the misconduct:
openA: Must leave the field of play and may not return until the next legal substitution 4-3, 18-1-1t opportunity.
O1: Must also be cautioned.
O2: Must leave the field of play and may not return until the next legal substitution opportunity.
O3: Must correct the illegal equipment but is not required to leave the field of play.
O4: Must leave the field of play and can return at the next dead ball.

Q: Before the game, the referee observes that A5 is wearing a very large knee brace.
openA: A5 may participate in the game while wearing a knee brace if it has not been 4-2-1f altered from the manufacturers original product.
O1: A5 may not participate in the game while wearing a knee brace.
O2: A5 may participate in the game while wearing a knee brace if it is completely covered with a neoprene sleeve.
O3: A5 may participate in the game while wearing a knee brace if it has not been altered from the manufacturers original product.
O4: A5 may participate in the game while wearing a knee brace if she can show the referee a doctors permission slip.

Q: Goalkeepers can wear any color socks they choose.
openA: The socks of the goalkeeper shall differ in color from the opposing field players. 4-1-1h(3)
O1: The socks of the goalkeeper shall differ in color from the opposing field players.
O2: The socks of the goalkeeper must be the same as his/her teammates.
O3: The goalkeeper can wear the same color socks as his/her opponents.
O4: The goalkeeper can wear two different colors of socks. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: Team As head coach has confirmed that all of her players are legally and properly equipped. However, before the game begins, the referee notices that A4 has shinguards that appear to be too small. The referee should:
openA: Ask A4 to show him the NOCSAE seal and height range on her shinguards. 4-1-1
O1: Accept the coachs confirmation as correct.
O2: Ask A4 to show him the NOCSAE seal and height range on her shinguards.
O3: Without seeing the NOCSAE seal and height range, tell A4 that she cannot play with those shinguards.
O4: Require A4 to change shinguards and caution A4s head coach.

Q: Team Bs head coach was cautioned earlier in the game after the referee discovered B5 was wearing an earring while playing in the game. Twenty-seven minutes later, the referee discovers that B1 is not wearing shinguards.
openA: B1 is cautioned for being illegally equipped. She is required to leave the field 4-3 PENALTY and, as the goalkeeper, must be replaced by either a substitute or a field player.
O1: The Team B head coach should receive a second caution for an illegally equipped player. The Team B coach is disqualified for receiving a second caution.
O2: B1 is cautioned for being illegally equipped. She is required to leave the field and, as the goalkeeper, must be replaced by either a substitute or a field player.
O3: Both B1 and the Team B head coach should be cautioned.
O4: Since Team B has already been cautioned for an illegally equipped player, the referee may ignore the absence of shinguards on B1.

Q: The home team is wearing apparel under the shorts and shirt that is visible.
openA: It is legal if the team members who chose to wear an undergarment are wearing 4-1-1d the same color.
O1: It is legal if the team members who chose to wear an undergarment are wearing the same color.
O2: The color of the visible apparel does not matter.
O3: It is legal as long as it doesn't conflict with the color of the visiting team.
O4: It needs to be reported to the state association.

Q: The player's shinguard:
openA: All of the above. 4-1-1
O1: Must have the NOCSAE seal and height range permanently marked on the shinguard.
O2: Shall not be modified from its original manufactured state.
O3: Shall be worn in the manner the manufacturer intended it to be worn.
O4: All of the above.

Q: A24 has been penalized for offside. A24 was standing at the penalty mark when the ball was kicked to him by a teammate. The second-last defender was standing at the top of the penalty area when the ball was received by A24.
openA: Team B restarts with an indirect free kick from the penalty mark. 11-1-3 PENALTY
O1: Team B restarts with a direct free kick from the penalty mark.
O2: Team B restarts with an indirect free kick from the penalty mark.
O3: Team B restarts with a direct free kick from the top of the penalty area.
O4: Team B restarts with an indirect free kick from the top of the penalty area.

Q: B19 is standing in an offside position. B12 kicks the ball forward but the ball deflects off A11 to B19. B19 should be:
openA: Penalized for being offside. 11-1-4b, DIAGRAM 12
O1: Allowed to continue with play as long as B19 passes the ball to B12.
O2: Allowed to continue with play.
O3: Penalized for being offside.
O4: Issued a caution for being offside. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: Player A2 is in an offside position when player A3 takes a shot on goal which the goalkeeper attempts to save and rebounds from the goalkeeper to A2. A2 shoots and scores. Ruling:
openA: Disallow the goal and award an indirect free kick to Team B. 11-1-4
O1: Disallow the goal and award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O2: Allow the goal.
O3: Disallow the goal and award a goal kick to Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal and award a penalty kick to Team A.

Q: A2, standing with the ball on his own half of the field and seeing A4 streaking for the goal, kicks the ball over the heads of the Team B defenders between himself and A4. B6 reaches over his hand and knocks down the ball. In the opinion of the referee, A4 would have had an obvious opportunity to score if he had received the ball from A2.
openA: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick and 12-2, 12-8-1f(6) disqualify B6 for serious foul play.
O1: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick.
O2: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick and caution B6 for unsporting behavior.
O3: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick and disqualify B6 for serious foul play.
O4: B6 is not guilty of handling.

Q: A8 is dribbling toward goal on a breakaway. The goalkeeper, B1, comes out of the goal area in an attempt to stop A8. A8 kicks the ball past B1 and attempts to run around B1, who is now on the ground. B1 reaches up with his hand and pulls down A8 as he attempts to run past.
openA: B1 is guilty of holding. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team A if he 12-8-2d(2) cannot apply advantage and disqualify B1 for serious foul play.
O1: B1 is guilty of holding. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team A.
O2: B1 is guilty of holding. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team A and disqualify B1 for serious foul play.
O3: B1 is guilty of holding. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team A if he cannot apply advantage and disqualify B1 for serious foul play.
O4: There is no offense. The referee should allow play to continue.

Q: A9 believes that he has been fouled by B4. The referee allows play to continue. A9 tells his teammate that the referee is an idiot.
openA: The referee may immediately stop play or she may wait until the ball is otherwise 12-8-2f out of play before disqualifying A9 for insulting language.
O1: The referee should immediately stop play and caution A9 for dissent.
O2: The referee should immediately stop play and disqualify A9 for insulting language.
O3: The referee may immediately stop play or he may wait until the ball is otherwise out of play before cautioning A9 for dissent.
O4: The referee may immediately stop play or she may wait until the ball is otherwise out of play before disqualifying A9 for insulting language.

Q: A9 scores a goal to make the score 1-0 with 1:30 left in the game. He runs toward the portion of the spectators dominated by his schools supporters, removes his shirt and waves it above his head.
openA: A9 is guilty of an excessive act that focuses attention on himself. The referee 12-8-1f(12), 12-8-1 should caution A9. SITUATION B (c)
O1: A9 is guilty of an excessive act that focuses attention on himself. The referee should caution A9.
O2: A9 is guilty of an excessive act that focuses attention on himself. The referee should disqualify A9.
O3: A9 is guilty of taunting. The referee should disqualify A9.
O4: A9 is not guilty of an offense. Play should restart with a Team B kickoff.

Q: B9 takes a throw-in, which his goalkeeper, B1, traps with his feet. B1 then dribbles the ball into the penalty area and picks it up with his hands in order to punt the ball. The officials should:
openA: Award an indirect free kick to Team A. 12-7-3 SITUATION B
O1: Award a penalty kick to Team A for handling by B1.
O2: At the next stoppage of play issue a caution to B1.
O3: Award an indirect free kick to Team A.
O4: Allow play to continue as there is no violation. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: Defender B7 handles the ball inside the penalty area, deflecting it to A3, who scores. What is the correct procedure:
openA: The referee should allow the goal, caution B7 and restart with a kickoff for Team 12-8-1f(13) B.
O1: The referee should disallow the goal, caution B7 and award a penalty kick to Team A.
O2: The referee should allow the goal, disqualify B7 and restart with a kickoff for Team B.
O3: The referee should not allow the goal, disqualify B7 and award a penalty kick to Team A.
O4: The referee should allow the goal, caution B7 and restart with a kickoff for Team B.

Q: During halftime, the referee notices that the visiting team's head coach is showing his players a video of action from the first half on his tablet. What action should be taken?
openA: Take no action. 12-8-1 SITUATION C
O1: Dismiss the coach.
O2: Take no action.
O3: Report the incident to the proper authorities.
O4: Caution the coach.

Q: During the game, the referee hears the home team's head coach using a bull horn to instruct her players on the far side of the field.
openA: Caution the coach. 12-8-1e
O1: Caution the coach.
O2: Dismiss the coach.
O3: Take no action.
O4: Report the incident to the proper authorities.

Q: Goalkeeper A1, having just saved a shot on goal, is standing in his own penalty area, holding the ball in the palm of his hand. B9 runs from behind A1 and heads the ball out of A1s hand. B9 then kicks the ball into the goal.
openA: B9 is guilty of an illegal charge. The referee should award Team A an indirect 12-4-3 free kick.
O1: B9 is guilty of an illegal charge. The referee should award Team A an indirect free kick.
O2: B9 is guilty of an illegal charge. The referee should award Team A an indirect free kick and caution B9 for unsporting behavior.
O3: B9 is guilty of dangerous play. The referee should award Team A an indirect free kick.
O4: B9 is not guilty of any offense. The referee should award the goal to Team B.

Q: Goalkeeper B1 deflects a hard shot. B1 bends over and picks up the ball before it is touched by an opposing player in the penalty area. The referee should award an indirect kick to Team A, which is:
openA: Not the correct call as the referee should allow play to continue. 12-7-2
O1: The correct call.
O2: Not the correct call as the referee should allow play to continue.
O3: Not the correct call as a penalty kick should be awarded.
O4: Not the correct call as a drop ball should be awarded.

Q: Player B4 is disqualified for receiving a second caution. The referee should:
openA: Show a yellow card followed by a red card and notify both coaches of the nature 12-8-2 SITUATION I of the misconduct.
O1: Allow B12 to substitute for B4 as soon as B4 leaves the field.
O2: Display a red and yellow card simultaneously.
O3: Show only a red card and not a yellow card.
O4: Show a yellow card followed by a red card and notify both coaches of the nature of the misconduct. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: The goalkeeper, A1, makes a save, catching the ball with his/her hands. The goalkeeper then runs toward the top of the penalty area, dropping the ball in order to punt it while still within the penalty area. The goalkeeper's momentum, however, causes his/her kicking foot to land outside the penalty area after the ball has been kicked.
openA: A1 has released the ball before leaving the penalty area. There is no violation. 12-2 EXCEPTION
O1: A1 has violated the restrictions on goalkeepers in 12-7. The referee should award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O2: A1 has violated the restriction on the number of steps a goalkeeper may take while holding the ball. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick.
O3: A1 has deliberately handled the ball. The referee should award a direct free kick to Team B.
O4: A1 has released the ball before leaving the penalty area. There is no violation.

Q: The head coach of Team A reaches onto the field to knock down a mid-air pass to B8, who is unmarked but still 45 yards away from the goal.
openA: The coach should be cautioned for unsporting conduct, and game restarted with 12-8-1f(1), 12-8-1f(7) a direct free kick.
O1: The coach should be cautioned for unsporting conduct, and game restarted with a direct free kick.
O2: The coach should be dismissed for failing to conduct himself in a responsible manner.
O3: The coachs behavior is outside interference and the referee should restart play with a drop ball.
O4: There is no offense and play should continue.

Q: Which of the following is considered unsporting conduct and will result in a caution?
openA: Committing a foul in a reckless manner. 12-8-1f(10)
O1: Taunting.
O2: Spitting at an opponent.
O3: Committing a foul in a reckless manner.
O4: Leaving the team area to participate in a fight.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. As B4 runs toward the ball to take the kick, A5 enters the penalty area before B4 kicks the ball. The referee should:
openA: Allow the play to continue and award a goal if the kick by B4 enters the goal. 14-1-2 PENALTY
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as A enters the penalty area.
O2: Allow the play to continue and award a goal if the kick by B4 enters the goal.
O3: Allow the play to continue and award a goal kick if the kick by B4 goes untouched over the goal.
O4: Allow the play to continue and award a corner kick if the kick by B4 is played by the goalkeeper who pushes the ball over the goal line outside of the goal.

Q: If during the taking of a penalty kick, A7 uses several stutter steps but does not interrupt his/her movement to the ball and scores, the correct ruling and restart is:
openA: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff by Team B. 14-1-4
O1: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff by Team B.
O2: Award an indirect free kick to Team B from the penalty mark.
O3: Disallow the goal and retake the penalty kick for Team A.
O4: Award a goal kick to Team B.

Q: If on a penalty kick there is a deflection over the goal line by the goalkeeper and no violation by either team, the restart is a:
openA: Corner kick. Penalty Kick Chart
O1: Retake.
O2: Indirect free kick.
O3: Corner kick.
O4: Goal Kick. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A3 uses a feint to one direction but does not interrupt the approach to the ball. The ball enters the goal. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team. 14-1-4
O1: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team.
O2: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution A7 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.

Q: Team B's goalkeeper is apparently injured. The referee has stopped play and summoned the Team B trainer onto the field of play. Team B has no available substitutes.
openA: B and C. 3-3-2(b)2
O1: Team B can play without a goalkeeper until the injured player returns.
O2: Team B goalkeeper must leave the field.
O3: A substitute goalkeeper must be identified.
O4: O2 and O3.

Q: During the pregame warm-up, the referee observes A4 wearing a tight-fitting, bucket-style cloth hat.
openA: This is permitted for a medical/cosmetic reason with state association approval. 4-2-10
O1: This is permitted for a medical/cosmetic reason with state association approval.
O2: Hat color must match the predominant color of the jersey.
O3: This is permitted if a physician's statement by a licensed medical physician is available on site.
O4: This is not permitted.

Q: Prior to the game, the referee is informed that player B4 must maintain a covered head for religious reasons. State association approval for the exception has been obtained.
openA: B4 is wearing a fitted skull cap beanie. 4-2-10
O1: B4 is wearing a baseball cap.
O2: B4 is wearing a leather doo rag.
O3: B4 is wearing a fitted skull cap beanie.
O4: B4 is wearing a bandanna covering the head which is knotted in back.

Q: The visiting team arrives for a contest wearing light gray jerseys and socks.
openA: The visiting team must change to an all-white jersey and socks if possible. If it is 4-1-1a, 4-1-1 not possible to correct the problem, the game shall be played and the state SITUATION H association notified.
O1: This is illegal and the visiting team must change prior to play.
O2: This is legal.
O3: The visiting team must change to an all-white jersey and socks if possible. If it is not possible to correct the problem, the game shall be played and the state association notified.
O4: This is illegal and the head coach should be cauitioned and the game shall be played.

Q: Visiting Team B is wearing white jerseys and socks. B1 is wearing a black long-sleeve undershirt, B2 is wearing black tights, and B3 is wearing a black arm sleeve.
openA: Illegal. Visible apparel does not match the predominant color
O1: B3 is wearing illegal equipment as arm sleeves are not allowed.
O2: This is legal.
O3: Illegal. Visible apparel does not match the predominant color of the uniform.
O4: Illegal as visible undergarments are not all alike. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: During an attack by Team A, A4 is laying injured on the ground in an offside position. A3 scores an apparent goal while A4 is in the offside position.
openA: Allow the goal as A4 was not involved in active play. 11-1-4
O1: Disallow the goal and penalize A4 for being offside.
O2: Disallow the goal and award a goal kick to Team B.
O3: Allow the goal, but caution A4 for an unsporting act.
O4: Allow the goal as A4 was not involved in active play.

Q: A4 is in an offside position when teammate A6 passes the ball to A4. A4 runs from the offside position into his/her own half of the field and receives the ball in his/her defensive half.
openA: A4 is penalized for offside. Award an indirect kick to B at the spot of the 11-1-4 infraction.
O1: Allow play to continue as A4 is in his/her own half of the field.
O2: A4 is penalized for offside. Award an indirect kick to B at the spot of the infraction.
O3: A4 is penalized for offside. Award an indirect kick to B at the spot where A6 made the pass.
O4: Allow play to continue as A4 was not involved in active play when the pass was made.

Q: A2, in the penalty area, is advancing the ball toward the opponent's goal with an obvious goal-scoring opportunity. B3, who is attempting to play the ball, fouls A2, who does not score a goal.
openA: Award Team A a penalty kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal- 12-8-1(f)15 scoring opportunity.
O1: Award Team A a penalty kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O2: Award Team A a penalty kick.
O3: Award Team A a penalty kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O4: Award Team A a corner kick.

Q: A2 is advancing the ball toward the opponent's goal with an obvious goal-scoring opportunity. B3, who is attempting to play the ball, fouls A2, who is outside the penalty area and does not score a goal.
openA: Award Team A a direct kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal- 12-8-2d(3) scoring opportunity.
O1: Award Team A a penalty kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O2: Award Team A a penalty kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O3: Award Team A a direct kick and caution B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O4: Award Team A a direct kick and disqualify B3 for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.

Q: During active play, Team B's coach enters the playing field to argue a call with the official, but does not interfere with active play.
openA: Award Team A an indirect kick from where the ball was when the referee 13-2-3a stopped play.
O1: Award Team A a direct kick from the point of the infraction.
O2: Award Team A an indirect kick from the point of the infraction.
O3: Resume play with a drop ball.
O4: Award Team A an indirect kick from where the ball was when the referee stopped play.

Q: During active play, Substitute/Bench Player B12 mistakenly thinks the ball has gone out of bounds and kicks the ball toward a teammate who is in play.
openA: Award Team A a direct kick from the point where B12 kicked the ball. 13-2-1j
O1: Award Team A a direct kick from the point where B12 kicked the ball.
O2: Award Team A an indirect kick from the point where B12 kicked the ball.
O3: Resume play with a drop ball at the point where B12 kicked the ball.
O4: Allow play to continue with no stoppage. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: If bench personnel are cautioned or disqualified:
openA: Substitutions from either team who have checked-in prior to the 3-3-3c, e; 3-4-1d caution/disqualification may enter the game.
O1: Substitutions may be made from the bench.
O2: Substitutions from the bench of the non-offending team may enter the game.
O3: Substitutions from either bench may enter the game.
O4: Substitutions from either team who have checked-in prior to the caution/disqualification may enter the game.

Q: In the last five minutes of a game, Team A is in the lead and requests a substitution.
openA: Allow the substitution and the clock is not stopped.
O1: Make Team A play short.
O2: Allow the substitution and the clock is not stopped.
O3: Stop the clock for the substitution.
O4: Caution the coach for unsporting behavior.

Q: Team A is awarded a corner kick and wants to substitute.
openA: The substitute is allowed only if they had reported to the table prior to the 3-4-1d stoppage.
O1: The substitution may be allowed to enter the game directly from the bench without having to report to the scorer's table.
O2: The substitute is allowed only if they had reported to the table prior to the stoppage.
O3: No substitutions are allowed on a corner kick.
O4: Allow only if both teams are subbing.

Q: The visiting coach does not have a roster with her at the game site.
openA: The game may not begin until the coach provides a roster. 3-1-3
O1: The game may not begin until the coach provides a roster.
O2: The game may begin if the coach promises to provide a roster by the end of the game.
O3: The game may begin if the coach promises to provide a roster by halftime.
O4: The game may begin but the referee should remind the coach that a roster is required for future games.

Q: B17 is wearing a cast that is completely covered and padded with closed-cell, slow-recovery foam padding no less than -inch thick. The referee should:
openA: Allow B17 to play as this is permitted by rule. 4-2-1c
O1: Verify B17 has a doctor's permission slip before allowing B17 to play.
O2: Allow B17 to play as this is permitted by rule.
O3: Request a certified athletic trainer or physician inspect and approve the cast and padding prior to B17 being allowed to play.
O4: Not permit B17 to play.

Q: During a stoppage in play the referee notices a player who is illegally equipped. After calling time-out to caution the coach, the illegally equipped player:
openA: Must be removed and may be replaced. 4-3, 18-1-1t
O1: May remain in the game after receiving a verbal admonishment for the illegal equipment.
O2: Must be removed and may be replaced.
O3: Must correct the equipment issue and may stay on the field.
O4: Must be removed and has to be replaced. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: Goalkeepers are required to:
openA: Have a 6-inch number on the back and no number on the front
O1: Have a 6-inch number on the back and front of their jersey.
O2: Have a 6-inch number on the back and a 4-inch number on the front of their jersey, pants or shorts.
O3: Have a 6-inch number on the back and no number on the front of their jersey.
O4: Have no numbers on their jersey.

Q: Player A from the visiting team enters the game wearing two different colored socks.
openA: Both socks must be the same color. 4-1-1b
O1: This is permitted.
O2: Both socks must be the same color.
O3: This is permitted if the whole team is wearing two different colored socks.
O4: This is permitted as long as the socks contrast with the home team's white socks.

Q: Team B is the home team and Team A is the visiting team. Before the game the referee notices that the visiting team is wearing a yellow jersey. The referee shall:
openA: Both O1 and O3
O1: Instruct the visiting team to put on a solid white jersey.
O2: Terminate the game and declare Team B the winner.
O3: If Team A does not have a white jersey, allow the game to be played and notify the state association.
O4: Both O1 and O3.

Q: The first time in a game that a player from Team B is found to be wearing illegal equipment, the coach of Team B is to be cautioned.
openA: Caution the head coach. 4-3
O1: Caution the head coach.
O2: The player is to be cautioned.
O3: Take no action, but write up the player in the game report.
O4: Allow the player to start, stop play and caution the player for wearing illegal equipment.

Q: While waiting for a corner kick to be taken by Team B, with Team A ahead, 2-1, in the second half, goalkeeper A1 pushes B7 to the ground from behind. B7 gets up and punches A1 in the face. Both teams then engage in a general brawl. After the fighting has ceased, the referee feels that because of the fight, further disorder will result and because of this, terminates the game.
openA: The referee has authority to terminate the game but does not have authority to 5-3-1i, 5-3-2e declare either team the winner.
O1: If both teams have seven eligible players after the referee has disqualified the appropriate players, the game must be restarted.
O2: The referee has authority to terminate the game and declare Team B the winner since the Team A player began the fight.
O3: The referee has authority to terminate the game. The 2-1 score for Team A stands as the official score since more than half the game was played.
O4: The referee has authority to terminate the game but does not have authority to declare either team the winner.

Q: Team A has a kickoff in the first half of play. Player A1 kicks the ball backward to Player A2. The official should:
openA: Allow play to continue. 8-1-3
O1: Order the kick to be retaken.
O2: Award a direct free kick to Team B.
O3: Require Team A to retake the kickoff.
O4: Allow play to continue. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: B3 is moving toward the goal with an opportunity to score. Goalkeeper A1 comes out of the penalty area and handles the ball in an attempt to prevent the goal; however, a goal is scored. What action should the referee take?
openA: Caution A1 for unsporting behavior and award the goal. 12-8-1f(6), 12-8-1f(13)
O1: Red Card A1 for serious foul play and award the goal.
O2: Red Card A1 for serious foul play and award a direct free kick to Team B at the spot of the foul.
O3: Yellow Card A1 for unsporting behavior and award a direct free kick to Team B at the spot of the foul.
O4: Caution A1 for unsporting behavior and award the goal.

Q: B9 attempts to head the ball, bending at the waist to a 90-degree angle in order to do so. A7, who is also standing there, attempts to volley the ball as it comes down. A7s attempt to kick the ball strikes B9 in the head. B9 is knocked unconscious and an ambulance must be summoned to remove him from the field.
openA: A7 is guilty of kicking an opponent. The referee should award Team B a direct free kick. The referee may also caution or disqualify A7.
O1: A7 is guilty of dangerous play. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick.
O2: A7 is guilty of kicking an opponent. The referee should award Team B a direct free kick. The referee may also caution or disqualify A7.
O3: B9 is guilty of dangerous play. The referee should award Team A an indirect free kick.
O4: Both players were simply attempting to play the ball and no offense has been committed by either of them.

Q: B9 runs towards the ball, which is rolling on the ground near the right goal post. A3 faces B9, with the ball behind her, and extends her arms wide to prevent B9 from running past her to get the ball. A3 does not make physical contact with B9. The ball rolls over the goal line for a goal kick.
openA: no offense
O1: A3 is guilty of pushing. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team B.
O2: A3 is guilty of pushing. The referee should award a penalty kick to Team B and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.
O3: A3 is guilty of obstruction. The referee should award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O4: There is no offense, and a goal kick should be awarded.

Q: The referee awards a direct free kick to Team B, 25 yards from the Team A goal. The goalkeeper, A1, who is the Team A captain, runs to the referee, who is at the spot of the foul, to argue that the foul should obviously be against the Team B player. The referee should:
openA: caution A1 for dissent. 12-8-1c
O1: allow A1 to speak to him, then ask him to return to his position.
O2: caution A1 for dissent.
O3: caution A4 for dissent as the captain has special privilages.
O4: allow play to continue.

Q: Which of the following is considered unsporting conduct and will result in a caution?
openA: Illegally equipped. 12-8-1f11
O1: Taunting.
O2: Spitting at an opponent.
O3: Illegally equipped.
O4: Leaving the team area to participate in a fight.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick:
openA: The goalkeeper shall stand on the goal line facing the kicker. 14-1-3
O1: The goalkeeper shall stand on the goal line facing the kicker.
O2: The goalkeeper may stand on the goal line facing the goal.
O3: The goalkeeper may stand on the goal line outside the goal posts.
O4: The goalkeeper may move before the ball is kicked. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A3 uses a feint to one direction and comes to a complete stop and then kicks the ball into the goal. The referee should:
openA: Disallow the goal and retake the kick. 14-1-4
O1: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by team.
O2: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick for Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution A7 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick for Team B.

Q: At the taking of a tie-breaking kick from the penalty mark, goalkeeper A1 deflects the kicked ball. As he celebrates, the balls momentum causes it to strike the ground and spin into the goal. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal. 14-1-6
O1: Disallow the goal as it happened after the goalkeeper's initial touch.
O2: Allow the goal.
O3: Have the kicker retake the kick.
O4: Allow the goal and caution the goalkeeper for the celebration.

Q: Team A has been awarded an indirect free kick 22 yards from the Team B goal. Four Team A players are standing near the ball. A8 taps the top of the ball with his foot and the ball does not move. A5 then kicks the ball, which enters the Team B goal without being touched by any other player.
openA: Award a goal kick to the defending team. 13-3-2, 18-1-1o
O1: Award a goal.
O2: Have Team A retake the kick.
O3: Award a goal kick to the defending team.
O4: Caution Player A8 for unsporting behavior.

Q: Which of the following is true if opposing teams choose to be on opposite sides of the field?
openA: The teams shall be diagonally across from each other. 1-5-3 EXCEPTION 1
O1: The teams must be directly opposite each other.
O2: The teams shall be diagonally across from each other.
O3: The teams are not allowed to be on opposite sides.
O4: The teams must make prior arrangements and notify the referee before the game.

Q: During inspection of the game balls supplied by the home team, the referees note that the balls do not have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
openA: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
O1: This is not permitted and the game may not begin until the referees obtain balls from the home or visiting team that have the NFHS Authenticating Mark.
O2: This is not permitted. If neither team has three similar quality game balls with the NFHS Authenticating Mark, the game may begin with balls chosen by the referee from those available.
O3: This is not permitted. If no balls with the NFHS Authenticating Mark are available, the game may begin if the home team can provide balls with the NCAA or FIFA logo on them.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: After a goal is scored:
openA: The referee will stop the clock, point to the center of the field, move to the kickoff 5-3-1b position and record the goal scorer.
O1: The referee will stop the clock, point to the center of the field, move to the kickoff position and record the goal scorer.
O2: The referee will notify the coaches of the goal scorer.
O3: The referee will point to the center of the field.

Q: An identifiable supporter of the home team seated in the designated spectator area is screaming profanities at the nearest assistant referee in disagreement with a decision about offside made by the assistant referee. The referee should:
openA: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate 5-3-2e action.
O1: Stop play and direct the spectator to leave the facility.
O2: Stop play and request that the home school administration take appropriate action.
O3: Stop play and inform the spectator that the assistant referees decision was correct.
O4: Allow play to continue and ignore the supporters language.

Q: In the 68th minute, with the score 2-1 for Team A, a confrontation between A5 and B11 escalates into a mass brawl. The referee and coaches eventually end the fight. In the opinion of the referee, A5 started the fight.
openA: The referee may terminate the game and shall report all conditions regarding the 5-3-2e, 5.3.2 incident to the proper authorities in writing. SITUATION B
O1: The referee may terminate the game and declare Team B the winner.
O2: The referee may terminate the game and declare Team A the winner.
O3: The referee may terminate the game and declare the game no contest.
O4: The referee may terminate the game and shall report all conditions regarding the incident to the proper authorities in writing. E. The referee may not terminate the game and should restart with a direct free kick for Team B.

Q: Pregame conferences shall be conducted by the head referee.
openA: The pregame conference must be attended by the team's head coach and 5-2-2d captains.
O1: The opposing captains are the only ones required to attend the pregame conference.
O2: The head referee is not required to hold a pregame conference.
O3: The pregame conference must be attended by the team's head coach and captains.
O4: The pregame conference is the assistant referee's responsibility.

Q: The game officials are observed using flags with buzzer/beeper capabilities during a match. The use of these flags is:
openA: Allowed unless the state association has expressly prohibited such equipment. 5-1-3f
O1: Prohibited.
O2: Permitted in all cases.
O3: Allowed unless the state association has expressly prohibited such equipment.
O4: Allowed only if both coaches agree.

Q: The jurisdiction of the officials shall begin:
openA: On arrival at the field of play and its immediate surroundings. 5-1-2
O1: No later than 15 minutes prior to the start of the game.
O2: On arrival at the field of play and its immediate surroundings.
O3: As soon as the game starts.
O4: As soon as the referee enters the field of play.

Q: If the Sample Overtime Procedures are followed by state association adoption, the interval between the first overtime period and the second overtime period shall be:
openA: Two minutes. 7-3-2
O1: No interval time allowed.
O2: Three minutes.
O3: Two minutes.
O4: Five minutes. Copyright  1990-2019 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.
