Q: Which statement does not allow an official to caution or disqualify a player?
openA: After the game has ended and the official has left the jurisdiction of the field of 5-1-2 play and its immediate surroundings.
O1: During the pregame introduction of players because the game has not started.
O2: During an injury stoppage.
O3: When the clock has stopped following a scored goal.
O4: After the game has ended and the official has left the jurisdiction of the field of play and its immediate surroundings.

Q: Since there is no visible clock available at the game site, the referee shall:
openA: Keep the official time on his or her watch and shall stop and start the watch at 5-3-2f, 6-2-1, 6-2-3a the times specified in Rule 6-2-3a.
O1: Not begin the contest until a visible clock is made available.
O2: Keep the official time on his or her watch and shall stop and start the watch at the times specified in Rule 6-2-3a.
O3: Keep the official time on his or her watch and add time to the end of each period as needed.
O4: Have the home team's coach keep the official time on the bench.

Q: A player shall be disqualified (red card) for:
openA: All of the above. 12-8-2d
O1: Disproportionate and unnecessary force against an opponent while playing the ball.
O2: Deliberately handling the ball (other than the goalkeeper) attempting to prevent a goal and the goal is not scored.
O3: Committing a foul, attempting to deny an obvious goal-scoring opportunity, and the goal is not scored.
O4: All of the above.

Q: A7 is on a breakaway, one on one with goalkeeper B1, near the penalty spot. As A7 attempts to run around B1, B6 runs in from behind A7 and tugs A7s jersey, pulling A7 off balance. As A7 falls, the right foot kicks the ball weakly toward the goal and it crosses into the goal at the far post.
openA: The goal should count, B6 should be shown the yellow card and required to 12-8-1f(14) leave the field of play and the game should be restarted with a kickoff by Team B.
O1: The goal should not be counted, B6 should be shown the red card and disqualified and Team A should be awarded a penalty kick.
O2: The goal should not be counted, B6 should be shown the yellow card and required to leave the field of play and Team A should be awarded a penalty kick.
O3: The goal should count, B6 should be shown the red card and disqualified and the game should be restarted with a kickoff by Team B.
O4: The goal should count, B6 should be shown the yellow card and required to leave the field of play and the game should be restarted with a kickoff by Team B.

Q: A7 receives a caution for a reckless tackle. Before leaving the field, or before a substitute has been beckoned in, A7 slams the ball down in protest.
openA: Display a second yellow and then a red card to A7 and not allow a substitute. 12-8-2c, 12-8-1c
O1: Display a red card to A7.
O2: Display a second yellow and then a red card to A7 and allow a substitute.
O3: Display a second yellow and then a red card to A7 and not allow a substitute.
O4: Have A7 leave the field for the first caution and take no further action.

Q: B9 is tripped by A6. The referee stops play and awards a free kick to Team B. A6 remains at the spot of the foul, between the ball and the goal defended by Team A, arguing that B9 fell over his leg and that there was no trip.
openA: The referee should caution A6 and require A6 to leave the spot of the foul. 12-8-1, 13-3-1
O1: The referee should caution A6 and require A6 to leave the spot of the foul.
O2: The referee should caution A6 for delaying the restart of play and also caution A6 for dissent. The referee should then disqualify A6 for receiving a second caution.
O3: The referee should ignore A6 and signal for the restart of play.
O4: The referee should move to a spot 10 yards closer to the goal defended by Team A and urge A6 to retreat to that position.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. The goalkeeper, A1, stands with back to the ball. The referee shall:
openA: Require the goalkeeper to face the kicker. 14-1-3
O1: Allow play to continue as this is permitted by rule.
O2: Require the goalkeeper to face the kicker.
O3: Suspend the contest until the goalkeeper agrees to face the kicker.
O4: Declare a forfeit.

Q: B17 is being replaced on a legal substitution opportunity for the team. What should happen next?
openA: B17 is considered to still be a player until B17's replacement, B12, is beckoned 18-1-1gg onto the field by the referee.
O1: B17 is considered to still be a player until B17's replacement, B12, takes a position on the field.
O2: B17 is considered to still be a player until B17's replacement, B12, is beckoned onto the field by the referee.
O3: B17 is considered to still be a player until B17's replacement, B12, steps onto the field.
O4: B17 is considered to still be a player until B17 has left the field and the game has been restarted.

Q: Prior to the game, whether the field is unsafe for play and the game should be canceled is the responsibility of:
openA: The host athletic director. 1-7
O1: The visiting coach.
O2: The host athletic director.
O3: The host coach.
O4: The referee.

Q: A game that must have a winner remains tied after overtime played under the NFHS Sample Tie-Breaking Procedure. The game will now proceed to a penalty kick tie-breaker. The Team B coach informs the referee of the desire to add a player to the teams roster, a junior varsity team player who has been sitting in the stands during the game. The coach reports that this player is legally and properly equipped.
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: The referee must allow this addition to the roster.
O2: This is not permitted.
O3: This is only permitted with the permission of the opposing coach.
O4: Allow the JV player to kick after all others have kicked.

Q: A6 has banged heads with an opponent while trying to head a high ball. The referee has stopped play and has determined that A6 has the signs of a possible concussion. The referee requires A6 to leave the field and informs A6's coach that A6 may have suffered a concussion. There is no state association rule about concussions beyond that contained in the NFHS rules book.
openA: The referee may allow A6 to return to the game if the coach indicates 3-3-2b(3) appropriate medical personnel has cleared the player.
O1: The referee should not allow A6 to return to the game after being cleared by an appropriate health-care professional.
O2: The referee may allow A6 to return to the game if the coach indicates appropriate medical personnel has cleared the player.
O3: The referee should allow A6 to return to the game if A6's coach has A6 report in per 3-4-1.
O4: The referee should not allow A6 to return until the opponent is able to return.

Q: B10 is apparently injured. The referee has stopped play and summoned the Team B trainer onto the field of play.
openA: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instructions. 3-3-2 SITUATION H
O1: Neither coach may give coaching instruction to the players during the injury stoppage.
O2: The Team A coach may give instruction to the Team A players but the Team B coach must only attend to the injured player.
O3: The Team B coach may only give instructions to the substitute for B10.
O4: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instructions.

Q: B7 is injured and is required to leave the field. Team B has no available substitutes and, therefore, must play short. Several minutes later, B7 has recovered from injury, and the coach has sent B7 to report in. What should happen next?
openA: B7 may enter the game at the next dead ball. 3-3-7 SITUATION A
O1: B7 may enter the game at the next legal substitution opportunity for the team.
O2: B7 may enter the game at the next dead ball.
O3: B7 may enter the game during the run of play.
O4: B7 may not enter the game until clearance has been provided by a doctor in writing.

Q: A player who is illegally equipped and whose coach is cautioned for the misconduct:
openA: Must leave the field of play and may not return until the next legal substitution 4-3-2, 18-1-1u opportunity.
O1: Must also be cautioned.
O2: Must leave the field of play and may not return until the next legal substitution opportunity.
O3: Must correct the illegal equipment but is not required to leave the field of play.
O4: Must leave the field of play and can return at the next dead ball.

Q: Before the game, the Team A head coach informs the referee that A15 will be wearing a hockey-style mask, due to an injury A15 received in a game the previous week.
openA: This is not permitted. 4-2-8, 4-2-1 SITUATION G
O1: This is not permitted.
O2: This is not permitted unless A15 can show the referee a doctors permission slip.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is permitted unless the mask has been painted in an objectionable manner.

Q: Goalkeepers shall wear socks that:
openA: Must differ in color of opposing field players. 4-1-1i(3)
O1: Are the same color as their teammates.
O2: Must be different than the color of all other field players.
O3: Must differ in color of opposing field players.
O4: Must differ in color of opposing goalkeeper.

Q: The referee observes a foul, but does not penalize it because the referee perceives an advantage; however, the advantage does not develop.
openA: The referee will let play continue because advantage was given.
O1: The referee will let play continue because advantage was given.
O2: The referee will stop play, caution the player who committed the original foul, and re-start with an indirect free kick.
O3: The referee will stop play, caution the player who committed the original foul, and re-start with a direct free kick.
O4: The referee shall immediately stop play and penalize the original foul.

Q: B14 takes a shot on goal, with goalkeeper A1 out of position. A3, however, extends the arm into the path of the ball, deflecting it to B9. B9 shoots and the ball enters the goal.
openA: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct. 5-3-1 SITUATION A, 12- 8-1f
O1: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O2: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.
O3: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O4: The referee should allow the goal and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.

Q: A2, standing with the ball on A2's own half of the field and seeing A4 streaking for the goal, kicks the ball over the heads of the Team B defenders between A2 and A4. B6 reaches over B6's head and knocks down the ball. A4 was in an offside position when A2 passed the ball.
openA: A4 is guilty of offside. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. 11-1-2 SITUATION D The referee may warn B6 about actions but does not have to give a caution.
O1: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick.
O2: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick and caution B6 for unsporting behavior.
O3: A4 is guilty of offside. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. The referee should caution B6 for unsporting behavior.
O4: A4 is guilty of offside. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. The referee may warn B6 about actions but does not have to give a caution.

Q: A player shall be disqualified, without caution, by the official when the player has completed the following action:
openA: Flagrantly fouls the goalkeeper who is in possession of the ball. 12-4-2a
O1: Hand ball.
O2: Kicks the ball out of bounds.
O3: Flagrantly fouls the goalkeeper who is in possession of the ball.
O4: Fakes an injury.

Q: During play, a goal gets moved back off the goal line away from the field, and the entire ball passes beyond the goal line but not beyond the goal posts. What is the outcome?
openA: This is a good goal. The goal is assumed to be in the proper position. Restart 1-4-1 with a kickoff.
O1: This is a good goal. The goal is assumed to be in the proper position. Restart with a kickoff.
O2: This is not a goal. Restart is an indirect free kick for the defending team.
O3: This is not a goal. Restart with an indirect free kick to the attacking team, from the point of the goal-area line nearest to where play was stopped.
O4: This is not a goal. Restart is a drop ball to the defending team.

Q: The home team has nets that are striped green and white to match its school colors. What should the referee do?
openA: Colored and/or striped nets are not illegal. Play the game. 1-4-2
O1: Declare the game a forfeit and award the win to the visiting team.
O2: Inform the coach that colored nets are illegal and must be correct by the next game, then notify the state association.
O3: Ask the visiting coach if the coach wishes to play the game as scheduled.
O4: Colored and/or striped nets are not illegal. Play the game.

Q: Student spectators have gathered behind the goal, standing on the ground and cheering their team during penalty kicks.
openA: No one is permitted directly behind the goal, unless they are in bleachers. Home 1-6 team management should remove the fans from behind the goal.
O1: This is ok.
O2: This is ok, as long as the fans are 10 feet behind the goal.
O3: This is ok as long as both teams fans are allowed to stay, and they remain 10 feet behind the goal.
O4: No one is permitted directly behind the goal, unless they are in bleachers. Home team management should remove the fans from behind the goal.

Q: Who decides whether a field is safe for play to begin?
openA: The home team athletic director decides if the field is playable prior to the game 1-7 beginning, but the head referee makes the decision once the game begins and until it ends.
O1: The head referee decides if the field is playable prior to the game beginning, but the home team athletic director makes the decision once the game begins and until it ends.
O2: The home team athletic director decides if the field is playable prior to the game beginning, but the head referee makes the decision once the game begins and until it ends.
O3: The head referee decides if the field is playable both prior to the game beginning and during the game.
O4: The home team athletic director decides if the field is playable both prior to the game beginning and during the game.

Q: After the second half starts, Player A is noticed to be wearing cleats with sharp metal studs (illegal equipment).
openA: The player must be removed and may be replaced and the head coach 4-3-2 cautioned.
O1: The player is to be cautioned.
O2: Take no action, but notify the state association after the game.
O3: The player must be removed and may be replaced and the head coach cautioned.
O4: Start play, then caution the player.

Q: As play resumes after a goal kick, a fight breaks out on the field next to the visiting bench. The benches from both teams clear and get involved in the mele. Once order is restored, the referee terminates the game.
openA: The referee has the authority to terminate or suspend the game when elements, 5-3-1i, 12-8-2 spectators or other causes require such action.
O1: The referee has the authority to terminate or suspend the game when elements, spectators or other causes require such action.
O2: The referee declares Team A as the winner since it was winning when the game ended.
O3: The referee may terminate the game and declare it a no contest.
O4: The referee can declare a winner if more than half the game is played.

Q: Team A is awarded a free kick outside the penalty area in front of its own goal. Player A1 takes the free kick which goes untouched into Team A's own goal. The correct procedure is:
openA: Award a corner kick to the opposing team. 17-1-1
O1: Award a goal to the opposing team.
O2: Allow Player A1 to retake the free kick.
O3: Drop ball outside the penalty area.
O4: Award a corner kick to the opposing team.

Q: Player A1 takes a corner kick but only moves the ball a few feet into the field of play. Player B1 comes to challenge, but Player A1 touches the ball before any other player. The official shall:
openA: Award an indirect free kick to Team B from the spot of the foul. 17-1-5
O1: Award an indirect free kick to Team B from the spot of the foul.
O2: Allow Player A1 to retake the corner kick.
O3: Award a throw-in to Team B at the nearest point of contact.
O4: Award a goal kick to Team B.

Q: Player A touches the ball forward with a portion of the arm above the armpit. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue. 12-2-1
O1: Allow play to continue.
O2: Award a direct free kick to the opposing team for handling.
O3: Award an indirect free kick to the opposing team for handling.
O4: Award a direct free kick to the opposing team and caution Player A.

Q: A goal may be scored directly from which of the following:
openA: A goalkeeper's throw into the team's own goal. 10-1-2f
O1: A goalkeeper's throw into the oppenent's goal.
O2: A goalkeeper's throw into the team's own goal.
O3: A throw-in.
O4: An indirect free kick.

Q: 10 minutes into the second half of play a game is ended due to lightning. The correct ruling is:
openA: The game is an official game unless otherwise set forth by state association 7-1-3 guidelines.
O1: The game is an official game regardless of state association guidelines on suspended games.
O2: The game must be restarted from the suspension of play regardless of state association guidelines on suspended games.
O3: The game must be rescheduled from the start regardless of state association guidelines on suspended games.
O4: The game is an official game unless otherwise set forth by state association guidelines.

Q: Player A enters the game with beads in the hair that are secured to the head in a bun. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue as there is no rule infraction. 4-2-2
O1: Allow play to continue as there is no rule infraction.
O2: Caution Player A and ask Player A to leave the field.
O3: Remove Player A and caution the head coach for an illegally equipped player.
O4: Do not caution the player or coach but ask Player A to leave the field and remove the beads.

Q: Goalkeeper A1 blocks a hard shot on goal by deliberately parrying the ball to the ground. As B11 runs toward the ball, the goalkeeper picks the ball up and punts it up field. The referee should:
openA: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for deliberately parrying the ball and 18-1-ee award a free kick to B11s team.
O1: Allow play to continue as this is legal.
O2: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for a double touch and award a free kick to B11s team.
O3: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for a double touch inside the team's own penalty area and award a penalty kick to B11s team.
O4: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for deliberately parrying the ball and award a free kick to B11s team.

Q: B7, in the opponents penalty area, is dribbling the ball toward the goal. A3 trips B7 while attempting to play the ball, ending a goal-scoring opportunity for B7. The referee should:
openA: Disqualify A3 and restart play with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O1: Disqualify A3 and restart play with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O2: Stop the clock and disqualify A3 for the tripping foul, restart with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O3: Stop the clock and display the yellow card to A3 and restart with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O4: Allow play to continue as the foul occurred while A3 was playing the ball and the trip was inadvertent.

Q: A player on Team B, not the goalkeeper, deliberately handles the ball while trying to stop a shot by Team A and the ball still goes in the goal. The correct ruling is:
openA: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and the goal is allowed to 12-8-1 stand.
O1: The player on Team B is disqualified (red card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O2: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and the goal is allowed to stand.
O3: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O4: The player on team B is disqualified (red card) and the goal is allowed to stand.

Q: A player on Team A is disqualified (red card) for receiving a second yellow card of the game. While this player is walking off of the field, a player from Team B approaches the player and claps in Team A player's face and tells the player to get off the field. The official should:
openA: Caution the player from Team B for taunting.
O1: Ask the player from Team B to stop and send the Team B player back to the player's position.
O2: Caution the player from Team B for taunting.
O3: Disqualify the player from Team B for taunting and not permit a substitute.
O4: Do nothing.

Q: A player on Team B, not the goalkeeper, deliberately handles the ball while trying to stop a shot by Team A and the ball does not go in the goal. The correct ruling is:
openA: The player on Team B is disqualified (red card) and Team A is given a penalty 12.8.1 and 12.8.2d kick. SITUATION E
O1: The player on Team B is disqualified (red card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O2: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and the goal is allowed to stand.
O3: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O4: The player on team B is disqualified (red card) and the goal is allowed to stand.

Q: During active play, Substitute/Bench player B12, thinking the ball is out of play, enters the field and receives the ball from a pass from teammate B4.
openA: Award Team A a direct free kick from the point of B12 receiving the ball and 13-2-1j caution B12.
O1: Allow play to continue.
O2: Award Team A a direct free kick from the point of B12 receiving the ball and caution B12.
O3: Resume play with a drop ball.
O4: Award Team A with an indirect free kick from point of infraction.

Q: During active play, Team A's coach steps onto the field to give instruction, but does not interfere with active play.
openA: Resume play with a drop ball.
O1: Resume play with a drop ball.
O2: Award Team B an indirect free kick from the point of infraction.
O3: Award Team B a throw-in from sideline where infraction occurred.
O4: Award Team B an indirect free kick from where the ball was when the referee stopped play and caution the coach.

Q: Team B has been awarded an indirect free kick 25 yards from Team A's goal. B6 kicks the ball and it rolls a yard before B4 kicks the ball, which enters the Team A goal without being touched by any other player.
openA: Award a goal. 13-3-2, 18-1-1(o)
O1: Award a goal.
O2: Have Team B retake the kick.
O3: Award a goal kick to Team A.
O4: Award an indirect free kick to Team A.

Q: Player A while taking a corner kick places the ball inside the corner arc and on the touchline. Players from Team B must be:
openA: At least 10 yards away from the corner arc until the ball is kicked. 17-1-2
O1: At least 10 yards away from where the ball is placed until the ball is kicked.
O2: At least 5 yards away from where the ball is placed until the ball is kicked.
O3: At least 10 yards away from the corner arc until the ball is kicked.
O4: At least 5 yards away from the corner arc until the ball is kicked.

Q: The referee has awarded Team A a penalty kick. As A20 runs toward the ball to take the kick, A11 enters the area before A20 kicks the ball. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue and award a retake if the penalty kick is scored. 14-1-2
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as A11 enters the penalty area.
O2: Allow play to continue and award a retake if the penalty kick is scored.
O3: Allow play to continue and award a goal kick for Team B if the penalty kick is scored.
O4: Caution player A20 and award a goal kick for Team B.

Q: During a penalty kick, the ball moves while the kicking player is approaching the ball but before the player has a chance to kick the ball. The referee should:
openA: Blow the whistle as soon as the ball moves and allow player A8 to reset the ball. 14-1-4
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as the ball moves and allow player A8 to reset the ball.
O2: Allow play to continue and if a goal is scored have player A8 retake the penalty kick.
O3: Blow the whistle and award an indirect kick to Team B.
O4: Allow play to continue and if the goalkeeper makes a save allow A8 to retake the penalty kick.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A16 uses a stutter-stepping approach with continuous movement toward the ball and the ball enters the goal. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team. 14-1-4
O1: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O2: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution player A16 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.

Q: Player B1 approaches the ball during a penalty kick and kicks it backwards to player B2. B2 shoots and misses over the top of the goal. The referee should:
openA: Award Team A an indirect free kick from the penalty mark. 14-1-4 PENALTY
O1: Award Team A a goal kick.
O2: Allow the penalty kick to be retaken.
O3: Restart play with a drop ball to Team A's goalkeeper.
O4: Award Team A an indirect free kick from the penalty mark.

Q: During a penalty kick, kicker A2 kicks the ball and it immediately deflates. What is the appropriate restart?
openA: Retake the penalty kick. 2-2-4
O1: Retake the penalty kick.
O2: Goal kick awarded to Team B.
O3: Corner kick awarded to Team A.
O4: Indirect free kick for Team B.

Q: If a goal kick is touched twice by the kicker before another player has touched the ball, what is the proper penalty?
openA: Indirect kick from the spot of the infraction. 16-1-1
O1: The goal kick is taken again.
O2: The kicker is cautioned and the kick is taken again.
O3: Indirect kick from the spot of the infraction.
O4: Direct kick taken from the closest position outside of the penalty area.

Q: A goal may be scored directly from a:
openA: Goal kick into the opponent's goal. 10-1-2c
O1: Throw-in.
O2: Dropped ball.
O3: Goal kick into the opponent's goal.
O4: Goal kick into a team's own goal.

Q: A goal should be allowed if the ball is between the goal posts, under the crossbar, and in which of the following cases?
openA: The entire ball is beyond the goal line. 10-1-1
O1: A portion of the ball is on the goal line.
O2: A portion of the ball is beyond the goal line.
O3: The entire ball is beyond the goal line.
O4: None of the above.

Q: A goal may NOT be scored directly from a:
openA: Goalkeeper's throw. 10-1-3c
O1: Kickoff.
O2: Direct kick.
O3: Punt.
O4: Goalkeeper's throw.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, the kick rebounds off the goalkeeper's back to an attacking player who entered the penalty area before the kick was taken. What happens?
openA: Indirect free kick. 14-1-6
O1: Retake the penalty kick.
O2: Play continues.
O3: Indirect free kick.
O4: Goal kick.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, the kick rebounds off the goalkeeper's back to a defending player who entered the penalty area before the kick was taken. What happens?
openA: Retake the penalty kick. 14-1-6
O1: Retake the penalty kick.
O2: Play continues.
O3: Indirect free kick.
O4: Goal kick.

Q: A1, an offensive player, steps off the field to avoid being called for offside. What is the ruling?
openA: Legal. A1 can leave the field if for the sole purpose of not being offside. 11-1-2
O1: Illegal. Offside should be called on A1.
O2: Illegal. A1 should be cautioned for the action.
O3: Legal. A1 can leave the field if for the sole purpose of not being offside.
O4: Illegal. Team A's head coach should be cautioned.

Q: A10, in an offside position, receives a header from B10. What is the ruling?
openA: Legal. A10 should be allowed to play the ball as it was last played by an opponent. 11-1-4
O1: Illegal. A10 should be called for offside.
O2: Legal. A10 should be allowed to play the ball as it was last played by an opponent.
O3: Legal, but A10 cannot score from the succeeding play on the ball.
O4: Illegal. A10 did not receive the ball from a deliberate play.

Q: A4 is in an offside position on the opponent's half of the field. A5 passes the ball to A4 who returns to A4's own half of the field and receives the ball.
openA: Illegal. A4 is still defined as offside. 11-1-4
O1: Legal. A4 is no longer offside upon return to A4's own half of the field.
O2: Legal. A4 negates the offside by returning to A4's half of the field.
O3: Illegal. A4 is still defined as offside.
O4: Illegal. A4 should be cautioned for unsporting conduct.

Q: Spectators enter the field and disrupt play. What does the referee have the authority to do?
openA: Terminate or suspend the game. 5-3-2e
O1: Stop play and caution the coach of the team that the spectators represent.
O2: Stop play and disqualify the coach of the team that the spectators represent.
O3: Terminate or suspend the game.
O4: None of the above.

Q: B19 is standing in an offside position. B12 kicks the ball forward but the ball deflects off A11 to B19. B19 should be:
openA: Penalized for being offside. 11-1-4b
O1: Allowed to continue with play as long as B19 passes the ball to B12.
O2: Allowed to continue with play.
O3: Penalized for being offside.
O4: Issued a caution for being offside.

Q: Attacker A4 is in an offside position when teammate A8 delivers the ball to A4 with a throw-in. A4 collects the ball and kicks it into the goal. The referee should:
openA: Award a goal to Team A. 11-1-2
O1: Award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O2: Award a goal to Team A.
O3: Award a goal kick to Team B.
O4: Award a re-take to Team A.

Q: Attacker A10, who is in an offside position, receives the ball from a goal kick by A2. What should happen next?
openA: Play is allowed to continue because there is no offside violation. 11-1-2
O1: The assistant referee waives the flag to indicate an offside violation.
O2: The referee stops play and awards an indirect free kick to Team B.
O3: Play is allowed to continue because there is no offside violation.
O4: The referee stops play and orders the goal kick to be retaken.

Q: The referee has awarded Team B a penalty kick. As B4 runs toward the ball to take the kick, A5 enters the penalty area before B4 kicks the ball. The referee should:
openA: Allow the play to continue and award a goal if the kick by B4 enters the goal. If the 14-1-2 PENALTY goal is not scored, it is retaken.
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as A5 enters the penalty area.
O2: Allow the play to continue and award a goal if the kick by B4 enters the goal. If the goal is not scored, it is retaken.
O3: Allow the play to continue and award a goal kick if the kick by B4 goes untouched over the goal.
O4: Allow the play to continue and award a corner kick if the kick by B4 is played by the goalkeeper who pushes the ball over the goal line outside of the goal.

Q: Player A2 takes a penalty kick during the game. The ball rebounds off the goalpost directly to A2 who shoots and scores.
openA: The referee shall not allow the goal and restart with an indirect kick. 14-1-5
O1: The referee shall allow the goal.
O2: The referee shall not allow the goal and restart with an indirect kick.
O3: The referee shall not allow the goal and restart with a goal kick.
O4: The referee shall order the kick retaken.

Q: If on a penalty kick there is a deflection out of bounds by the goalkeeper and no violation by either team, the restart is a:
openA: Corner kick. 14-1 Penalty Kick Chart
O1: Retake.
O2: Indirect free kick.
O3: Corner kick.
O4: Goal kick.

Q: Player As throw-in lands completely outside the touchline, without having broken the plane of the touchline, and the ball bounces into the field of play. What should the referee do?
openA: The referee orders a re-throw by Team A
O1: The referee orders a re-throw by Team A since the ball was never put into play.
O2: The referee awards a throw-in to Team B.
O3: The referee allows play to continue.
O4: The referee cautions the thrower.

Q: While positioned in the opponent's half of the field, attacker A2 receives the ball directly from a goal kick taken by a teammate. There are fewer than two opponents between A2 and the attacking goal line.
openA: A2 has not committed an offside offense because A2 received the ball directly from a 11-1-1b, Diagram 22 goal kick. Offside
O1: A2 should be ruled offside because there are not at least two opponents nearer their own goal than A2 when the ball is received.
O2: The official rules "play on."
O3: A2 has not committed an offside offense because A2 received the ball directly from a goal kick.
O4: The official blows the whistle and awards Team B an indirect kick for the violation.

Q: The home teams logo obscures the halfway line. What is the best referee response?
openA: The field is illegal, but the official should start the game and notify the state 1-2-1, 1-2-3 association following the game.
O1: The field is not properly marked. Do not start the game.
O2: Request the game management to apply temporary paint to form a halfway line, then start the game.
O3: The field is illegal, but the official should start the game and notify the state association following the game.
O4: The field is legal. Start the game.

Q: During inspection of the field, the referee determines the penalty area is 45 yards wide. What is the best referee response?
openA: Start the game and use the lines as marked. Contact the state association after the 1-2-1, 1-2-6 game.
O1: The field is illegally marked. Do not start the game.
O2: Start the game, but make a mental note of where the boundary should be and make calls using the mental/invisible lines.
O3: Start the game and use the lines as marked. Contact the state association after the game.
O4: Ask coaches if they wish to play the game with the mismarked field.

Q: The home team and the visiting team are both wearing white shorts.
openA: This is permitted. 4-1-3
O1: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing dark shorts.
O2: This is permitted.
O3: The referee should not begin the game until the home team is wearing shorts of a different color than the visiting team.
O4: The home team should change to dark shorts. If unable to correct, the game shall be played and the referee must notify the state association following the game.

Q: If the ball becomes deflated during play and is declared dead, how is play restarted?
openA: Drop ball at the spot where it was last played to the team that last possessed the ball. 2-2-4, 9-2-1b, 9-2-3
O1: Direct free kick.
O2: Throw-in for the team last in possession.
O3: Indirect free kick at the spot where it was last played to the team that last possessed the ball.
O4: Drop ball at the spot where it was last played to the team that last possessed the ball.

Q: Which of the following needs to be included on the team roster:
openA: All of the above. 3-1-3
O1: Players.
O2: Bench personnel.
O3: Coaches.
O4: All of the above.

Q: The visiting team arrives at the game site and the goalkeeper's jersey does not have a number.
openA: The visiting team should change to a legal goalkeeper jersey. If unable to correct, the 4-1-2 game shall be played and the referee must notify the state association following the game.
O1: The visiting team should change to a legal goalkeeper jersey. If unable to correct, the game shall be played and the referee must notify the state association following the game.
O2: The game should not start until corrected.
O3: The officials should allow the game to start, but caution the head coach before kickoff.
O4: The officials should allow the game to begin but caution the head coach at the first stoppage.

Q: A player enters the game wearing beads in the hair that are securely wrapped in a bun and secured to the head. The official shall:
openA: Take no action and allow the player to enter. The hair adornment is legal. 4-2-3
O1: Require the player to leave the game.
O2: Issue a caution to the player and at the next stoppage of play have the player replaced or rectify the issue.
O3: Take no action and allow the player to enter. The hair adornment is legal.
O4: Card the head coach and replace the player.

Q: The hosting school schedules a junior varsity and varsity match on the same day. After the JV match has concluded, the visiting JV team stays to watch its varsity team. During the match, the JV players from the spectator stands are shouting comments containing abusive language toward the referees that are causing game management issues. The referee should:
openA: Suspend the match and request game management to take appropriate action with 5-3-2e the JV team members.
O1: Allow play to continue and ignore the comments from the spectators.
O2: Suspend the match and request game management to take appropriate action with the JV team members.
O3: Stop play and yell up to the stands a warning that the game will be suspended and/or terminated if their behavior continues.
O4: Stop play and direct the JV players to leave the playing area and board their schools bus for the remainder of the varsity match.

Q: Player A1 passes the ball to A3 using the shoulder area above the armpit. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue. 12-3-1
O1: Blow the whistle and award a direct free kick to a player from Team B for handling.
O2: Blow the whistle and award an indirect free kick to a player from Team B for an accidental handling.
O3: Allow play to continue.
O4: Blow the whistle and award an indirect free kick to a player from Team A for an unintentional handling.

Q: The goalkeeper for Team A is wearing light blue socks. The goalkeeper's teammates are wearing black socks.
openA: Legal as long as Team B is not wearing light blue socks. 4-1-4f
O1: Legal as long as Team B is not wearing light blue socks.
O2: The official must remove the goalkeeper from the field until a change is made to black socks to match teammates.
O3: Legal even if the opposing team is also wearing light blue socks.
O4: Legal as long as the socks match the goalkeeper's jersey.

Q: With 1 minute and 30 seconds left in the first half of play, Team A has a two-goal lead. When the ball goes out of play for a goal kick, Team A makes a substitution. The official timer should:
openA: Notify the official of the substitution. 7-4-3
O1: Notify the official of the substitution.
O2: Notify the official of the substitution and stop the clock since the team in the lead is subbing.
O3: Disallow the substitution and do not notify the official.
O4: Notify the official of the substitution and stop the clock until the losing team also makes a substitution.

Q: B2 is pulled down by the jersey by A5. The referee stops play and awards a free kick to Team B. A5 then picks up the ball and begins walking away with the ball yelling the player fell down on their own.
openA: The referee should caution A5 and require A5 to leave the field of play. 12-9-1c, 13-3-1
O1: The referee should grab the ball out of the player's hand and place at spot of the foul and signal for the restart of play.
O2: The referee should ignore A5 and wait until A5 puts the ball down.
O3: The referee should give Team B two more yards for its free kick.
O4: The referee should caution A5 and require A5 to leave the field of play.

Q: After a goal by Team B, a player on Team A stands in the opponents half of the field and kicks the ball backward after the official blows the whistle to restart the game. Before the ball is touched by another player, the same player kicks the ball again to redirect it.
openA: This is illegal and Team B should be awarded an indirect free kick. 8-1-2, 8-1-4
O1: This is legal and play should continue.
O2: This is illegal and the kick should be retaken.
O3: This is illegal and Team B should be awarded a direct free kick.
O4: This is illegal and Team B should be awarded an indirect free kick.

Q: The goalkeeper, before taking a goal kick, moves from the right side of the goal area to the left side of the goal area before spotting the ball.
openA: This is allowed, but if this is deemed a time-wasting ploy, the referee shall stop the 12-9-1f(2), 16-1-3 clock and caution the goalkeeper.
O1: Immediately stop play and give corner kick to opponent.
O2: The referee shall stop the clock and restart once the ball is put into play.
O3: If this is considered time-wasting, the referee shall award an indirect kick.
O4: This is allowed, but if this is deemed a time-wasting ploy, the referee shall stop the clock and caution the goalkeeper.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, kicker B2 plays the ball backward to teammate B5 who shoots and scores a goal. What is the correct restart?
openA: An indirect free kick for the defending team. 14-1
O1: The penalty kick is retaken.
O2: Allow the goal and restart with a kickoff for the defending team.
O3: An indirect free kick for the defending team.
O4: A goal kick.

Q: The referee observes Player A1 wearing socks with the foot cut off.
openA: This is legal as long as the visible material under the sock (and above the ankle) is 4-1-1 similar in color to the predominant color of the sock.
O1: This is illegal. Cut socks cannot be worn.
O2: This is illegal. The color of the foot of the sock must match the body of the sock.
O3: This is legal as long as the visible material under the sock (and above the ankle) is similar in color to the predominant color of the sock.
O4: This is legal. The color of the visible material under the sock does not matter.

Q: On a corner kick, the defending team should be positioned 10 yards away from the:
openA: Corner arc. 17-1-2
O1: Ball.
O2: Corner flag.
O3: Corner arc.
O4: Touchline.

Q: Team A is in the lead during the last five minutes of the game. Team B has a substitute who has reported to the official area and is ready to substitute. Team A then sends a player to report to the official area and is ready to substitute. The ball goes out of play and Team B is awarded a throw-in. The official shall:
openA: Allow the substitutions and the clock is not stopped.
O1: Not stop the clock if both teams are substituting.
O2: Allow the substitutions and the clock is not stopped.
O3: Stop the clock for the substitutions.
O4: Caution the Team A coach for unsporting conduct.

Q: A player from Team B kicks the ball toward a teammate. The ball strikes the hand of a player from Team A whose back is to the kicker and holding their hands at their side. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue as no foul occurred. 12-3-1
O1: Award an indirect free kick to Team B.
O2: Award a direct free kick to Team B.
O3: Award a drop ball to the kicker from Team B.
O4: Allow play to continue as no foul occurred.

Q: Each team shall submit a team roster. Which of the following is not permitted once the game starts?
openA: None of the above are prohibited and can happen at any time. 3-1-3
O1: Add players to the roster.
O2: Change uniform numbers on the roster.
O3: Add bench personnel to the roster.
O4: None of the above are prohibited and can happen at any time.

Q: A player's jersey may include which of the following optional items within size restrictions?
openA: All of the above. 4-1-1f
O1: An American flag.
O2: A commemorative patch.
O3: A memorial patch.
O4: All of the above.

Q: Which of the following has direct supervision over ball holders?
openA: The officials. 6-1-2
O1: The home team's coach.
O2: The away team's coach.
O3: The officials.
O4: Game management.

Q: During play, player A1 appears injured. The referee whistles to stop play. When is the player required to leave the field?
openA: The player must leave the field because play was stopped for an injury.
O1: The player must leave the field because play was stopped for an injury.
O2: The player must leave the field once the referee stops the clock.
O3: The player must leave the field once the referee stops the clock and beckons on the coach or appropriate health- care professional.
O4: The player must leave the field once the player has been deemed injured by the coach or appropriate health-care professional.

Q: The ball strikes the referee standing on the field just outside the goal area and the ball subsequently enters the goal. What is the appropriate restart?
openA: Drop ball to the team that last touched the ball
O1: Indirect free kick.
O2: Kickoff.
O3: Drop ball to the team that last touched the ball prior to hitting the referee.
O4: Drop ball to the defending team's goalkeeper.

Q: Player A1 kicks the ball and it deflects off the referee standing on the field near the halfway line, and the ball goes directly over the touchline. What is the appropriate restart?
openA: Throw-in for Team B. 9-1-1a, 9-1-2b, 15-1-1
O1: Drop ball to a player on Team A.
O2: Drop ball to a player on Team B.
O3: Indirect free kick.
O4: Throw-in for Team B.

Q: A second whistle is required to restart play for all of the following except:
openA: A direct free kick. 9-1-3
O1: A penalty kick.
O2: A direct free kick.
O3: After a substitution.
O4: After a caution or disqualification.

Q: A10 is in an offside position. Defender B12 deliberately extends their leg to play the ball. The ball then inadvertently goes toward A10. The official shall:
openA: Allow play to continue. 11-1-5
O1: Allow play to continue.
O2: Penalize A10 for being offside and restart with an indirect free kick for Team B.
O3: Penalize A10 for being offside and restart with a direct free kick for Team B.
O4: Award a direct free kick to Team B.

Q: Player A3 has hair beads at the end of a pony tail secured to their head with a bun. During play, the bun comes undone allowing the pony tail with beads to swing freely. At the next stoppage, what should the referee do?
openA: Ask A3 to correct their equipment, and if not immediately correctable, ask A3 to leave 4-2-3 the field without a caution.
O1: Require A3 to immediately leave the field without a caution.
O2: Ask A3 to correct their equipment, and if not immediately correctable, ask A3 to leave the field without a caution.
O3: Require A3 to immediately leave the field and caution A3's head coach.
O4: Ask A3 to correct their equipment, and if not immediately correctable, ask A3 to leave the field and caution their head coach.

Q: Team A is awarded a direct free kick and asks the referee to enforce 10 yards. Team B places two players in a defensive wall and are properly positioned by the referee. Player A1 stands next to Team B's wall. Is A1's position legal?
openA: Yes, because the defensive wall has fewer than three defenders. 13-3-1
O1: No, attackers must remain at least 1 yard away from any defensive wall.
O2: No, attackers must remain at least 5 yards away from any defensive wall.
O3: No, attackers must remain at least 1 yard away from a defensive wall of two or more defenders.
O4: Yes, because the defensive wall has fewer than three defenders.

Q: The referee shall signal an indirect free kick by raising an arm above their head. How long is this signal to be maintained after the ball is kicked?
O1: Until the ball clearly moves.
O2: Until the ball touches another player.
O3: Until the ball goes out of play.
O4: B or C.

Q: Team A is awarded an indirect free kick. Player A1 steps on top of the ball without it clearly moving. Player A4 then shoots the ball directly into the opponent's goal. The referee should:
openA: Disallow the goal and award a goal kick to Team B. 10-1-3a, 16-1-1
O1: Award a goal and restart the match with a kickoff for Team B.
O2: Disallow the goal and have Team A retake the indirect free kick.
O3: Disallow the goal and award Team B an indirect free kick.
O4: Disallow the goal and award a goal kick to Team B.

Q: A game that must have a winner remains tied after overtime played under the NFHS Sample Tie-Breaking Procedure. The game will now proceed to a penalty kick tie-breaker. The Team B coach informs the referee of the desire to add a player to the teams roster, a JV team player who has been sitting in the stands during the game. The coach reports that this player is legally and properly equipped.
openA: This is not permitted.
O1: The referee must allow this addition to the roster.
O2: This is not permitted.
O3: This is only permitted with the permission of the opposing coach.
O4: Allow the JV player to kick after all others have kicked.

Q: B10 is apparently injured. The referee has stopped play and summoned the Team B trainer onto the field of play.
openA: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instructions. 3-3-2 SITUATION H
O1: Neither coach may give coaching instruction to the players during the injury stoppage.
O2: The Team A coach may give instruction to the Team A players but the Team B coach must only attend to the injured player.
O3: The Team B coach may only give instructions to the substitute for B10.
O4: Both coaches may give their teams coaching instructions.

Q: B7 is injured and is required to leave the field. Team B has no available substitutes and, therefore, must play short. Several minutes later, B7 has recovered from injury, and the coach sends B7 to report in. What should happen next?
openA: B7 may enter the game at the next dead ball after reporting to the officials' area and 3-3-7 SITUATION A being beckoned by the referee.
O1: B7 may enter the game at the next legal substitution opportunity for the team from anywhere on the field.
O2: B7 may enter the game at the next dead ball after reporting to the officials' area and being beckoned by the referee.
O3: B7 may enter the game during the run of play.
O4: B7 may not enter the game until clearance has been provided by a doctor in writing.

Q: Before the game, the Team A head coach informs the referee that A15 will be wearing a hockey-style mask, due to an injury A15 received in a game the previous week.
openA: This is not permitted. 4-2-8, 4-3-1
O1: This is not permitted.
O2: This is not permitted unless A15 can show the referee a doctors permission slip.
O3: This is permitted.
O4: This is permitted unless the mask has been painted in an objectionable manner.

Q: Goalkeepers shall wear socks that:
openA: Must differ in color of opposing field players. 4-1-4f
O1: Are the same color as their teammates.
O2: Must be different than the color of all other field players.
O3: Must differ in color of opposing field players.
O4: Must differ in color of opposing goalkeeper.

Q: The referee observes a foul, but does not penalize it because the referee perceives an advantage; however, the advantage does not develop.
openA: The referee will let play continue because advantage was given.
O1: The referee will let play continue because advantage was given.
O2: The referee will stop play, caution the player who committed the original foul, and re-start with an indirect free kick.
O3: The referee will stop play, caution the player who committed the original foul, and re-start with a direct free kick.
O4: The referee shall immediately stop play and penalize the original foul.

Q: B14 takes a shot on goal, with goalkeeper A1 out of position. A3, however, extends the arm into the path of the ball, deflecting it to B9. B9 shoots and the ball enters the goal.
openA: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct. 12-9-1f
O1: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O2: The referee should award Team B a penalty kick and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.
O3: The referee should allow the goal and caution A3 for unsporting conduct.
O4: The referee should allow the goal and disqualify A3 for serious foul play.

Q: A2, standing with the ball on A2's own half of the field and seeing A4 streaking for the goal, kicks the ball over the heads of the Team B defenders between A2 and A4. B6 reaches over B6's head and knocks down the ball. A4 was in an offside position when A2 passed the ball.
openA: A4 is guilty of offside. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. The 11-1-4 referee may warn B6 about actions but does not have to give a caution.
O1: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick.
O2: B6 is guilty of handling. The referee should award Team A a direct free kick and caution B6 for unsporting behavior.
O3: A4 is guilty of offside. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. The referee should caution B6 for unsporting behavior.
O4: A4 is guilty of offside. The referee should award Team B an indirect free kick. The referee may warn B6 about actions but does not have to give a caution.

Q: A player shall be disqualified, without caution, by the official when the player has completed the following action:
openA: Flagrantly fouls the goalkeeper who is in possession of the ball. 12-5-2a
O1: Hand ball.
O2: Kicks the ball out of bounds.
O3: Flagrantly fouls the goalkeeper who is in possession of the ball.
O4: Fakes an injury.

Q: During play, a goal gets moved back off the goal line away from the field, and the entire ball passes beyond the goal line but not beyond the goal posts. What is the outcome?
openA: This is a good goal. The goal is assumed to be in the proper position. Restart with a 1-4-1 kickoff.
O1: This is a good goal. The goal is assumed to be in the proper position. Restart with a kickoff.
O2: This is not a goal. Restart is an indirect free kick for the defending team.
O3: This is not a goal. Restart with an indirect free kick to the attacking team, from the point of the goal-area line nearest to where play was stopped.
O4: This is not a goal. Restart is a drop ball to the defending team.

Q: The home team has nets that are striped green and white to match its school colors. What should the referee do?
openA: Colored and/or striped nets are legal. Play the game. 1-4-2
O1: Declare the game a forfeit and award the win to the visiting team.
O2: Inform the coach that colored nets are illegal and must be correct by the next game, then notify the state association.
O3: Ask the visiting coach if the coach wishes to play the game as scheduled.
O4: Colored and/or striped nets are legal. Play the game.

Q: Student spectators have gathered behind the goal, standing on the ground and cheering their team during penalty kicks.
openA: No one is permitted directly behind the goal, unless they are in bleachers. Home team 1-6 management should remove the fans from behind the goal.
O1: This is ok.
O2: This is ok, as long as the fans are 10 feet behind the goal.
O3: This is ok as long as both teams fans are allowed to stay, and they remain 10 feet behind the goal.
O4: No one is permitted directly behind the goal, unless they are in bleachers. Home team management should remove the fans from behind the goal.

Q: Who decides whether a field is safe for play to begin?
openA: The home team athletic director decides if the field is playable prior to the game 1-7 beginning, but the head referee makes the decision once the game begins and until it ends.
O1: The head referee decides if the field is playable prior to the game beginning, but the home team athletic director makes the decision once the game begins and until it ends.
O2: The home team athletic director decides if the field is playable prior to the game beginning, but the head referee makes the decision once the game begins and until it ends.
O3: The head referee decides if the field is playable both prior to the game beginning and during the game.
O4: The home team athletic director decides if the field is playable both prior to the game beginning and during the game.

Q: After the second half starts, Player A is noticed to be wearing cleats with sharp metal studs (illegal equipment).
openA: The player must be removed and may be replaced and the head coach cautioned. 4-1-6
O1: The player is to be cautioned.
O2: Take no action, but notify the state association after the game.
O3: The player must be removed and may be replaced and the head coach cautioned.
O4: Start play, then caution the player.

Q: As play resumes after a goal kick, a fight breaks out on the field next to the visiting bench. The benches from both teams clear and get involved in the melee. Once order is restored, the referee terminates the game.
openA: The referee has the authority to terminate or suspend the game when elements, 5-3-1i, 12-9-2 spectators or other causes require such action.
O1: The referee has the authority to terminate or suspend the game when elements, spectators or other causes require such action.
O2: The referee declares Team A as the winner since it was winning when the game ended.
O3: The referee may terminate the game and declare it a no contest.
O4: The referee can declare a winner if more than half the game is played.

Q: Team A is awarded a free kick outside the penalty area in front of its own goal. Player A1 takes the free kick which goes untouched into Team A's own goal. The correct procedure is:
openA: Award a corner kick to the opposing team. 17-1-1
O1: Award a goal to the opposing team.
O2: Allow Player A1 to retake the free kick.
O3: Drop ball outside the penalty area.
O4: Award a corner kick to the opposing team.

Q: Player A1 takes a corner kick but only moves the ball a few feet into the field of play. Player B1 comes to challenge, but Player A1 touches the ball before any other player. The official shall:
openA: Award an indirect free kick to Team B from the spot of the foul. 17-1-5
O1: Award an indirect free kick to Team B from the spot of the foul.
O2: Allow Player A1 to retake the corner kick.
O3: Award a throw-in to Team B at the nearest point of contact.
O4: Award a goal kick to Team B.

Q: Player A touches the ball forward with a portion of the arm above the armpit. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue. 12-3-1
O1: Allow play to continue.
O2: Award a direct free kick to the opposing team for handling.
O3: Award an indirect free kick to the opposing team for handling.
O4: Award a direct free kick to the opposing team and caution Player A.

Q: A goal may be scored directly from which of the following:
openA: A goalkeeper's punt into the team's own goal. 10-1-1
O1: A goalkeeper's throw into the opponent's goal.
O2: A goalkeeper's punt into the team's own goal.
O3: A throw-in.
O4: An indirect free kick.

Q: 10 minutes into the second half of play a game is ended due to lightning. The correct ruling is:
openA: The game is an official game unless otherwise set forth by state association 7-1-3 guidelines.
O1: The game is an official game regardless of state association guidelines on suspended games.
O2: The game must be restarted from the suspension of play regardless of state association guidelines on suspended games.
O3: The game must be rescheduled from the start regardless of state association guidelines on suspended games.
O4: The game is an official game unless otherwise set forth by state association guidelines.

Q: Player A enters the game with beads in the hair that are secured to the head in a bun. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue as there is no rule infraction. 4-2-3
O1: Allow play to continue as there is no rule infraction.
O2: Caution Player A and ask Player A to leave the field.
O3: Remove Player A and caution the head coach for an illegally equipped player.
O4: Do not caution the player or coach but ask Player A to leave the field and remove the beads.

Q: Goalkeeper A1 blocks a hard shot on goal by deliberately parrying the ball to the ground. As B11 runs toward the ball, the goalkeeper picks the ball up and punts it up field. The referee should:
openA: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for deliberately parrying the ball and award a 18-1-1gg free kick to B11s team.
O1: Allow play to continue as this is legal.
O2: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for a double touch and award a free kick to B11s team.
O3: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for a double touch inside the team's own penalty area and award a penalty kick to B11s team.
O4: Whistle for a foul against the goalkeeper for deliberately parrying the ball and award a free kick to B11s team.

Q: B7, in the opponents penalty area, is dribbling the ball toward the goal. A3 trips B7 while attempting to play the ball, ending a goal-scoring opportunity for B7. The referee should:
openA: Disqualify A3 and restart play with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O1: Disqualify A3 and restart play with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O2: Stop the clock and disqualify A3 for the tripping foul, restart with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O3: Stop the clock and display the yellow card to A3 and restart with a penalty kick for B7s team.
O4: Allow play to continue as the foul occurred while A3 was playing the ball and the trip was inadvertent.

Q: A player on Team B, not the goalkeeper, deliberately handles the ball while trying to stop a shot by Team A and the ball still goes in the goal. The correct ruling is:
openA: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and the goal is allowed to stand. 12-9-1
O1: The player on Team B is disqualified (red card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O2: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and the goal is allowed to stand.
O3: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O4: The player on team B is disqualified (red card) and the goal is allowed to stand.

Q: A player on Team A is disqualified (red card) for receiving a second yellow card of the game. While this player is walking off of the field, a player from Team B approaches the player and claps in Team A player's face and tells the player to get off the field. The official should:
openA: Caution the player from Team B for taunting
O1: Ask the player from Team B to stop and send the Team B player back to the player's position.
O2: Caution the player from Team B for taunting.
O3: Disqualify the player from Team B for taunting and not permit a substitute.
O4: Do nothing.

Q: A player on Team B, not the goalkeeper, deliberately handles the ball while trying to stop a shot by Team A and the ball does not go in the goal. The correct ruling is:
openA: The player on Team B is disqualified (red card) and Team A is given a penalty kick. 12-9-1f(16)
O1: The player on Team B is disqualified (red card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O2: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and the goal is allowed to stand.
O3: The player on Team B is cautioned (yellow card) and Team A is given a penalty kick.
O4: The player on team B is disqualified (red card) and the goal is allowed to stand.

Q: During active play, Substitute/Bench player B12, thinking the ball is out of play, enters the field and receives the ball from a pass from teammate B4.
openA: Award Team A a direct free kick from the point of B12 receiving the ball and caution 13-2-1j B12.
O1: Allow play to continue.
O2: Award Team A a direct free kick from the point of B12 receiving the ball and caution B12.
O3: Resume play with a drop ball.
O4: Award Team A with an indirect free kick from point of infraction.

Q: During active play, Team A's coach steps onto the field to give instruction, but does not interfere with active play.
openA: Resume play with a drop ball.
O1: Resume play with a drop ball.
O2: Award Team B an indirect free kick from the point of infraction.
O3: Award Team B a throw-in from sideline where infraction occurred.
O4: Award Team B an indirect free kick from where the ball was when the referee stopped play and caution the coach.

Q: Team B has been awarded an indirect free kick 25 yards from Team A's goal. B6 kicks the ball and it rolls a yard before B4 kicks the ball, which enters the Team A goal without being touched by any other player.
openA: Award a goal. 13-3-2, 18-1-1(q)
O1: Award a goal.
O2: Have Team B retake the kick.
O3: Award a goal kick to Team A.
O4: Award an indirect free kick to Team A.

Q: Player A while taking a corner kick places the ball inside the corner arc and on the touchline. Players from Team B must be:
openA: At least 10 yards away from the corner arc until the ball is kicked. 17-1-2
O1: At least 10 yards away from where the ball is placed until the ball is kicked.
O2: At least 5 yards away from where the ball is placed until the ball is kicked.
O3: At least 10 yards away from the corner arc until the ball is kicked.
O4: At least 5 yards away from the corner arc until the ball is kicked.

Q: The referee has awarded Team A a penalty kick. As A20 runs toward the ball to take the kick, A11 enters the area before A20 kicks the ball. The referee should:
openA: Allow play to continue and award a retake if the penalty kick is scored. 14-1-2
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as A11 enters the penalty area.
O2: Allow play to continue and award a retake if the penalty kick is scored.
O3: Allow play to continue and award a goal kick for Team B if the penalty kick is scored.
O4: Caution player A20 and award a goal kick for Team B.

Q: During a penalty kick, the ball moves while the kicking player is approaching the ball but before the player has a chance to kick the ball. The referee should:
openA: Blow the whistle as soon as the ball moves and allow player A8 to reset the ball. 14-1-4
O1: Blow the whistle as soon as the ball moves and allow player A8 to reset the ball.
O2: Allow play to continue and if a goal is scored have player A8 retake the penalty kick.
O3: Blow the whistle and award an indirect kick to Team B.
O4: Allow play to continue and if the goalkeeper makes a save allow A8 to retake the penalty kick.

Q: During the taking of a penalty kick, A16 uses a stutter-stepping approach with continuous movement toward the ball and the ball enters the goal. The referee should:
openA: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team. 14-1-4
O1: Disallow the goal and retake the kick.
O2: Allow the goal and restart with kickoff by the defending team.
O3: Disallow the goal and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.
O4: Disallow the goal, caution player A16 for unsporting play and restart with an indirect kick by Team B.

Q: Player B1 approaches the ball during a penalty kick and kicks it backwards to player B2. B2 shoots and misses over the top of the goal. The referee should:
openA: Award Team A an indirect free kick from the penalty mark. 14-1-4 PENALTY
O1: Award Team A a goal kick.
O2: Allow the penalty kick to be retaken.
O3: Restart play with a drop ball to Team A's goalkeeper.
O4: Award Team A an indirect free kick from the penalty mark.

Q: Prior to the game, an official notices that there are no marked team areas. The official shall:
openA: Allow the game to take place and notify the state association. 1-5
O1: Suspend the game.
O2: Allow the game to take place and notify the state association.
O3: Refuse to begin the game until the team areas are properly marked.
O4: Caution the home team coach.

Q: The goalkeeper for Team A and a player for Team B collide and the ball goes out of play. The referee stops the clock to prevent play from continuing but does not beckon the coach or trainer onto the field for either player. After a moment, the players catch their breath and do not appear to be injured. The referee then directs the play to be restarted. The referee shall:
openA: Allow the play to be restarted without requiring either player to leave the field as 3-3-2b (2,3) neither the coach nor the appropriate medical personnel was beckoned onto the field.
O1: First require both players to leave the field as the clock was stopped for an apparent injury.
O2: First check with appropriate medical personnel to determine whether play may resume.
O3: Allow the play to be restarted without requiring either player to leave the field as neither the coach nor the appropriate medical personnel was beckoned onto the field.
O4: Require written authorization from appropriate medical personnel to allow either player to continue to play that day.

Q: A player is being replaced. Where can the player exit the field?
openA: At the closest boundary line to expedite the substitution.
O1: On the bench side of the field. If benches are on opposite sides, the player must exit toward their own bench.
O2: At the closest boundary line to expedite the substitution.
O3: At any point on the field.
O4: At the goal line.

Q: The visiting team arrives at the game wearing solid white jerseys and black shorts. The official shall:
openA: Allow the game to be played as this is a legal visiting uniform. 4-1-2, 4-1-3
O1: Require the visiting team to change to light-colored shorts before the start of the game.
O2: Tell the visiting team coach that the uniform is illegal, allow the game to be played and notify the state association
O3: Ensure that the visiting team's socks are the same color as their shorts.
O4: Allow the game to be played as this is a legal visiting uniform.

Q: Team A players are wearing electronic performance and tracking clips on their shoes.
openA: Wearable technology is allowed and may be worn on the shoes. Allow the game to 4-2-11 proceed as the clips are legal.
O1: Caution the coach for illegal equipment and require Team A to remove the clips.
O2: Wearable technology is allowed but cannot be visible. Require Team A to move the clips so they are under their uniforms and not visible.
O3: Wearable technology is allowed and may be worn on the shoes. Allow the game to proceed as the clips are legal.
O4: Do not allow Team A to wear the clips unless the opposing team also has similar clips.

Q: The following are duties of the assistant referee during pregame except:
openA: Review specific duties with scorer. 5-2-3
O1: Review specific duties with scorer.
O2: Assist the head referee or center referee in inspecting the game balls and field of play.
O3: Review duties and responsibilities with ball holders.
O4: Assist with the pregame conference with team captains.

Q: When does an official's jurisdiction over a game end?
openA: When the officials leaving the field of play and its immediate surroundings. 5-1-2
O1: When the second half or overtime is complete.
O2: When the officials leaving the field of play and its immediate surroundings.
O3: When the official completes the game report.
O4: When the officials are on their way home.

Q: In the second half of a game, the stadium clock/scoreboard malfunctions and is no longer functioning. How will the time and the score be kept?
openA: The head referee will keep the time and score as no other means are available. 5-3-2f
O1: The official timer will regularly announce the time over the PA until the end of the game.
O2: The assistant referee and official timer will maintain time and score.
O3: The head referee will keep the time and score as no other means are available.
O4: The game shall be suspended until a replacement clock and scoreboard can be found.

Q: Player A2 is on a breakaway. Player B2 approaches A2 just as A2 moves the ball forward and past B2. The ball moves out of reach of both players and B2 moves between A2 and the ball. The referee shall:
openA: Rule Player B2 guilty of obstruction and award an indirect free kick to Team A at the 12-6-1 spot of the foul.
O1: Rule Player B2 guilty of obstruction and award an indirect free kick to Team A at the spot of the foul.
O2: Stop play and warn both players about dangerous play. Restart with a drop ball at the spot of the infraction.
O3: No infraction has occurred. Play shall continue.
O4: Stop play and caution B2 before awarding a direct free kick to Team A at the spot of the foul.

Q: The referee disqualifies a coach for leaving the team area, entering the field of play and arguing a call.
openA: The coach must leave the vicinity of the playing area. Refusal to comply shall result in 12-9-3c termination of the game.
O1: The coach shall be allowed to remain in the team area but may not actively coach the rest of the contest.
O2: The coach must leave the team area but is allowed to move to the fan/patron side of the field to watch the remainder of the contest.
O3: The coach must leave the team area but is allowed to stand outside the team area (near the corner of the field or on the goal end of the field) to watch the remainder of the contest as long as there is no communication between the coach and players or bench personnel.
O4: The coach must leave the vicinity of the playing area. Refusal to comply shall result in termination of the game.

Q: Which one of the following considerations are not part of Denying an Obvious Goal Scoring Opportunity (DOGSO)?
openA: Serious foul play. 12-9-4a
O1: General direction of play.
O2: Distance between the offense and the goal.
O3: Serious foul play.
O4: Likelihood of keeping or gaining control of the ball.

Q: When a defender commits a foul against an attacker in their own penalty area which denies an opponent an obvious goal-scoring opportunity by pulling, pushing or holding, what is the correct decision?
openA: Penalty Kick and disqualify (red card) the defender. 12-9-2d(4)
O1: Penalty Kick.
O2: Penalty Kick and caution (yellow card) the defender.
O3: Indirect Free Kick for a dangerous play.
O4: Penalty Kick and disqualify (red card) the defender.

Q: A defender, standing in front of the defender's goal, extends own arm away from the body and prevents the shot from entering the goal. What is the correct decision the referee needs to make?
openA: Penalty Kick and disqualify (red card) the defender for denying an obvious goal- 12-9-2d(2) scoring opportunity.
O1: Penalty Kick and caution (yellow card) the defender.
O2: Allow play to continue as there has been no violation.
O3: Penalty Kick and disqualify (red card) the defender for denying an obvious goal-scoring opportunity.
O4: Penalty Kick.

Q: During a penalty kick taken during the game, all players except the kicker and opposing goalkeeper shall be:
openA: Within the field of play, but outside the penalty area and at least 10 yards from and 14-1-2 behind the penalty mark until the ball is kicked.
O1: Within the confines of the team area.
O2: Behind the halfway line.
O3: Within the field of play, but outside the penalty area and at least 10 yards from and behind the penalty mark until the ball is kicked.
O4: Within the field of play, but outside the penalty area and at least 10 yards from the penalty mark until the ball is kicked.

Q: At the taking of a throw-in near the halfway line, the ball is thrown in but hits the ground before entering the field of play. What decision should the referee make?
openA: Allow the team taking the throw-in to retake the throw-in
O1: Allow the team taking the throw-in to retake the throw-in from the same spot.
O2: Allow play to continue. No violation has occurred.
O3: Award a throw-in to the opposing team.
O4: Award an indirect free kick to the opposing team from the nearest point on the touch line.

Q: When a player on Team A commits the team's first foul (accidental tripping) of the game in Team A's offensive end of the field in a careless manner, the referee shall:
openA: Call the foul and direct the play be restarted with a direct free kick. 12-1-2, 18-1-1q Copyright  1990-2023 National Federation of State High School Associations. All rights reserved.
O1: Call the foul, and issue a caution (yellow card) to the offending player on Team A.
O2: Call the foul and direct the play be restarted with a direct free kick.
O3: Call the foul and issue a disqualification (red card) to the offending player on Team A.
O4: Call the foul and direct play to be restarted with a indirect free kick.

Q: The referee observes Player B6 is wearing illegal equipment on the field while the ball is in play. This is the first occurrence of illegal equipment being worn by Team B and the referee determines there is no immediate danger. The correct ruling is:
openA: At the next stoppage, caution (yellow card) B6
O1: Stop play and caution (yellow card) Team B's head coach.
O2: Stop play and caution (yellow card) B6.
O3: At the next stoppage, caution (yellow card) Team B's head coach.
O4: At the next stoppage, caution (yellow card) B6.

Q: A10 is in an offside position. Defender B12, with time, space and clear sight of the ball, extends their leg in an attempt to clear the ball. The ball then inadvertently goes toward A10. The official shall:
openA: Allow play to continue.
O1: Allow play to continue.
O2: Penalize A10 for being offside and restart with an indirect free kick for Team B.
O3: Penalize A10 for being offside and restart with a direct free kick for Team B.
O4: Award a direct free kick to Team B.

Q: Player A is part of a wall in a free kick. After the ball is kicked, Player A moves their hands toward their face for protection. The ball then hits the hand of Player
openA: Allow play to continue with no foul as this is a reflex action and not considered to be deliberate handling.
O1: Stop play and caution Player A for handling and award a new free kick from the spot of the foul.
O2: Stop play, and red card Player A for DOGSO.
O3: Allow play to continue with no foul as this is a reflex action and not considered to be deliberate handling.
O4: Stop play and award a new direct kick from where Player A deliberately handled the ball.

Q: Both teams have a substitute waiting to enter the game. The referee stops play for a foul committed by Team A and awards a direct free kick to Team B. No player is injured and there was no misconduct. Which of the following statements is true?
openA: Both teams' substitutes are allowed to enter the game.
O1: Only Team A's substitute is allowed to enter the game.
O2: Only Team B's substitute is allowed to enter the game.
O3: Both teams' substitutes are allowed to enter the game.
O4: Neither teams' substitutes are allowed to enter the game.

Q: Player A spits at Player B during a verbal altercation.
openA: Player A is ejected and shown the red card for spitting at Player B.
O1: Players A and B are both cautioned and shown the yellow card for the verbal altercation.
O2: Player A is ejected and shown the red card for spitting at Player B.
O3: Player A is cautioned and shown the yellow card for spitting at Player B.
O4: Players A and B are both ejected and shown the red card for violent conduct.

Q: During play, Player A1 appears injured. The referee whistles to stop play. When is the player required to leave the field?
openA: The player must leave the field once the referee beckons the coach or appropriate health-care professional.
O1: The player must leave the field because play was stopped for an injury.
O2: The player must leave the field once the referee stops the clock.
O3: The player must leave the field once the referee beckons the coach or appropriate health-care professional.
O4: The player must leave the field once the player has been deemed injured by the coach or appropriate health-care professional.

Q: A goal may not be scored directly from a:
openA: Dropped Ball.
O1: Kickoff.
O2: Dropped Ball.
O3: Goal Kick.
O4: Penalty Kick.

Q: When determining whether an obvious goal-scoring opportunity (DOGSO) has been denied, the following must be considered and present:
openA: All of the above.
O1: Direction of play and distance between the offense and the goal.
O2: Likelihood of keeping or gaining control of the ball.
O3: Location and number of defenders.
O4: All of the above.

Q: Coach A is observed using a vape pen on the sideline but 50 feet from a player.
openA: This is not allowed in any circumstance.
O1: This is permitted as long as the coach has approval from the athletic administrator.
O2: This is not allowed in any circumstance.
O3: This is permitted with a doctor or trainer's permission for medical reason.
O4: This is permitted.

Q: Team A is awarded a throw-in near the halfway line. Player A2 stands on the touchline and starts to throw the ball in from behind and over their head. Before releasing the ball, A2 stops, turns in a different direction, and throws the ball in from behind and over their head. The referee:
openA: Allows play to continue as this is legal.
O1: Blows the whistle for an illegal throw and awards a throw-in to Team B.
